title: Will Over Half A Million Sharks Be Killed for COVID-19 Vaccine?
subtitle: A natural oil produced in shark livers is often - but not always - used in the manufacturing of vaccinations.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Shark Allies, a shark conservation group, estimated that as many as 550,000 wild sharks could be killed for their squalene, a natural chemical found in their liver, to produce a COVID-19 vaccine.

title: Did Karen Pence Fail To Wear a Mask During the VP Debate?
subtitle: The second lady appeared on stage at the vice presidential debate without a mask - but that isn't the complete story.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. second lady Karen Pence did not wear a mask during the vice presidential debate in October 2020.

title: Was Hunter Biden Dishonorably Discharged from the Navy?
subtitle: Many people are under the mistaken impression that military discharges come in one of two forms: honorable or dishonorable.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joe Biden's son Hunter was dishonorably discharged from the Navy for cocaine use.

title: Does Biden Support the Green New Deal?
subtitle: Presidential hopeful Joe Biden's position on climate change became a hot topic on the first night of the presidential debates in the fall of 2020.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: U.S. 2020 Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden does not support the set of climate change proposals set forth by other members of his party known as the "Green New Deal."

title: Did Trump 'Refuse to Condemn' White Supremacists at Debate?
subtitle: "Who do you want me to condemn? Who?" the president asked Fox News moderator Chris Wallace, in an extraordinary exchange during the first presidential debate in September 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: During the Sept. 29, 2020, presidential debate, U.S. President Donald Trump "refused" to condemn white supremacists.

title: Did Biden Promise 'Fewer Fires, Floods, and Hurricanes' If Elected?
subtitle: In a September 2020 address, Biden called Trump a “climate arsonist” and “climate denier.”
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: While on the campaign trail in September 2020, U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden promised fewer fires, floods, and hurricanes if he wins the election in November.

title: Did Joe Biden Lie About a Drunken Driver's Killing His Wife?
subtitle: A few weeks after Biden was first elected to the U.S. Senate, his wife and 1-year-old daughter were killed in an automobile accident while Christmas shopping.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Joe Biden lied in claiming that the accident that killed his wife and daughter involved a driver who had been drinking.

title: Did Trump Say 'Obama Should Leave Office' Before Appointing Supreme Court Justice?
subtitle: Allegations of "hypocrisy" were ample in September 2020 as U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to nominate a successor to Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In April 2016, Donald Trump said that then-U.S. President Obama should "wait until he leaves office to pick another Justice" after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia.

title: Did Trump Ban All Travel From China at the Start of the Pandemic?
subtitle: Trump credits an early 2020 ban on travelers from mainland China as his signature move to tackle the pandemic.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In February 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump enforced a complete ban on travel from mainland China, a signature policy move that helped save many lives from the spread of COVID-19 in the U.S.

title: Did a BLM Member Kill 3 People at a Retired Police Officer's Bar?
subtitle: The fatal shooting of three people was politicized when rumors circulated on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A man wearing a "Justice for Breonna Taylor" shirt murdered three people at a retired cop's bar.

title: Which Party Is More Effective at Reducing Abortions?
subtitle: It is hard to draw a straight line between federal government policy (let alone presidential policy) and abortion procurement.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The abortion rate in the U.S. has declined more under Democratic administrations than Republican ones due to a difference in approach.

title: Did Trump Say He Might Sign an Exec Order Barring Biden Presidency?
subtitle: "Was he joking?" has become a frequent question for reporters, and voters, since Trump began his political career in 2015.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump said he might sign an executive order barring Joe Biden from ever becoming U.S. president.

title: Is Kohl's Selling BLM Merchandise?
subtitle: Anti-racism is not synonymous with the Black Lives Matter movement, and vice versa.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2020, Kohl's announced it would begin selling a line of Black Lives Matter merchandise.

title: Was Trump Given a 'Bay of Pigs' Award?
subtitle: The Bay of Pigs refers to the failed 1961 invasion of Cuba led by U.S. Special Forces.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: An organization once awarded U.S. President Donald Trump a Bay of Pigs recognition award.

title: Did Kamala Harris Tell Jacob Blake She Was 'Proud of Him'?
subtitle: The vice presidential candidate met with Blake's family in Wisconsin after police shot Blake several times in the back.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris met with Jacob Blake - who, a meme claimed, "raped a woman” - and told him that she was “proud of him” in September 2020.

title: Is Michigan Gov. Whitmer Building an Electrified Fence Around Her Residence?
subtitle: Conservatives decried the governor's planned security upgrade after she opposed U.S. President Donald Trump's costly border wall.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer - who has previously spoken out against the U.S. border wall with Mexico - is getting security upgrades at her official residence that include an 8-foot-tall, electrified fence.

title: Did CDC Tell Parents To Prepare for 'Sudden Sleepover' at Schools Due to COVID-19?
subtitle: As the coronavirus pandemic dragged on into fall 2020, so did the spread of fearmongering rumors.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention advised parents to prepare for a “sudden sleepover” in the event of an emergency, which included COVID-19 outbreaks in schools.

title: Did Trump Tell People To Vote Twice?
subtitle: Don't vote twice.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump told people they should vote twice in the 2020 presidential election.

title: Were 39 Missing Children Found in a Trailer in Georgia?
subtitle: Operation Not Forgotten, spearheaded by the U.S. Marshals, resulted in the rescue of dozens of missing and endangered children.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Thirty-nine missing children were found in a double-wide trailer in the state of Georgia.

title: Did Kamala Harris Support Abortion Until the Time of Giving Birth?
subtitle: The Democratic vice-presidential candidate's pro-abortion-rights record has come under scrutiny from conservatives.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris, D-Calif., supports the ability to carry out abortions up until the time a woman gives birth.

title: Did Kenosha Leaders Require Police Body Cams, Then Fail To Buy Them?
subtitle: None of the responding officers wore body cameras at the scene where Jacob Blake was shot multiple times by police in August 2020.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Before the police shooting of Jacob Blake in August 2020, city leaders in Kenosha, Wisconsin, passed a city law "requiring" all officers to wear body cameras but did not buy the devices.

title: Is This Greenland Shark Nearly 400 Years Old?
subtitle: Greenland sharks can reach lengths of up to 24 feet and weigh more than 2,000 pounds.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A viral picture depicted a Greenland shark believed to be 392 years old.

title: Is This Meme About Trump and Epstein Accurate?
subtitle: A social media meme sought to exonerate U.S. President Donald Trump from any connection with Jeffrey Epstein's sex crimes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme provides information exonerating U.S. President Donald Trump from any connection with Jeffrey Epstein's sex crimes.

title: Do Ballot Envelopes Reveal the Party of the Voter?
subtitle: A widely seen video posted to Facebook raised fears about election tampering.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Mail-in ballots reveal the political party of the voter, meaning that Postal Service employees can tamper with election results.

title: Did Kamala Harris Say Young Voters Are 'Stupid'?
subtitle: There's some important missing context in this claim.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Kamala Harris called voters aged 18-24 years old "stupid."

title: Was a Black Man Charged in the Killing of a White 5-Year-Old in North Carolina?
subtitle: Conservative Americans claimed the mainstream news media (apart from Fox News) schemed to keep the death of Cannon Hinnant quiet.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: A Black man was charged in North Carolina in the killing of Cannon Hinnant, a 5-year-old white boy, and except for Fox News, mainstream news media outlets purposely ignored it to further a predetermined racial narrative.

title: Did Kamala Harris Have an Extramarital Affair with Willie Brown That Boosted Her Career?
subtitle: Harris long ago distanced herself from the relationship.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris had an extramarital affair with former San Francisco Mayor and State Assembly Speaker Willie Brown, who gave her two political appointments that launched her political career.

title: Has Biden Never Owned Stocks, Bonds, or a Savings Account?
subtitle: First elected to office at age 29, Joe Biden had consistently been ranked one of the least wealthy senators before his eight years as vice president.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden has never owned a stock or bond, and has never had a savings account.

title: Did Kamala Harris Say She 'Believes' Joe Biden's Accusers?
subtitle: Right-leaning websites jumped into action after Biden announced Harris as his vice-presidential running mate in August 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris has said she believes women who have accused former Vice President Joe Biden of various offenses, ranging from inappropriate touching to rape.

title: Did Louisiana High Court Uphold Black Man's Life Sentence For Stealing Hedge Clippers?
subtitle: An attempted burglary that occurred more than 20 years ago got rolled into a life sentence under a state law.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: A Black man was sentenced to life in prison in 1997 for stealing hedge clippers - a decision upheld by Louisiana's Supreme Court in July 2020.

title: Was an Indiana Woman Arrested on Suspicion of Voter Fraud in 2020?
subtitle: While both are election crimes, there is a difference between modifying mail-in ballots and modifying applications for ballots.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Janet Reed, a Democratic activist in Indiana, was arrested in 2020 on suspicion of selecting Democratic candidates on more than 400 mail-in ballots.

title: Did Trump Vow to 'Terminate' Social Security?
subtitle: The president articulated several different plans for payroll taxes during a press conference at his golf club in August 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In August 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to "terminate" Social Security.

title: Does Sunscreen Contain Harmful Chemicals?
subtitle: In 2019, the FDA proposed a rule that would update sunscreen regulations to reflect current scientific understanding of the effects of its ingredients.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: Sunscreen contains certain chemicals that have been linked to adverse human health effects, including neurological issues and seizures.

title: Did a Pennsylvania Voter Receive Two Usable Ballots?
subtitle: "Even if a person receives multiple ballots, only one return ballot can be counted," according to Allegheny County.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: One Pennsylvania resident received two mail-in ballots in 2020, both of which could be used in an upcoming election.

title: Did an MSNBC Producer Quit Because the Network Is a 'Cancer,' Stoking 'National Division'?
subtitle: Former MSNBC producer Ariana Pekary expressed discomfort with the commercial news model.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An MSNBC producer quit her job with a scathing letter calling the network a "cancer."

title: Did Minneapolis Police Tell Residents to 'Cooperate' With Robbers After City Defunded Cops?
subtitle: Things aren't as simple as a convenient narrative suggests.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Minneapolis police advised residents to submit to robbers after the city defunded the police department.

title: Is This a Pic of Marijuana Under a Scanning Electron Microscope?
subtitle: Marijuana does not look nearly this colorful unless, possibly, you're under its influence.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a cannabis bud under a scanning electron microscope.

title: Will a Trump Order Drop Insulin Price to 'Pennies A Day'?
subtitle: The president described it as a "massive cost savings," but the fine print of his executive order lacked specifics.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump issued an executive order in July 2020 that will lower the price Americans pay for insulin to "pennies a day."

title: Did Pelosi Decry Trump's Police Tactics While Funding Them?
subtitle: Top Democrats were quick to criticize the president's "law and order" approach to policing on Twitter. But do their budget decisions say otherwise?
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi publicly criticized the actions of federal agents in U.S. cities during protests in 2020 - while simultaneously supporting a budget bill that would fund such law enforcement efforts.

title: Are Americans Receiving Unsolicited Mailings of Seeds from China?
subtitle: Numerous U.S. residents have reported receiving seeds in the mail from China that they did not order.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Residents of various U.S. states have received unsolicited mailings of seeds sent from China with malicious intent.

title: Did Kroger Supermarkets Overcharge Customers Due to a Coin Shortage?
subtitle: Widely shared Facebook posts claimed that Kroger's new policy was to not give out cash change.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the summer of 2020, Kroger supermarkets introduced a policy of refusing to give customers cash change, as shown in an incident in Bourbonnais, Illinois.

title: Were Portland Protesters 'Kidnapped' by Federal Officers in Unmarked Vans?
subtitle: The claim surfaced as U.S. President Donald Trump prepared to deploy federal law enforcement agents in Chicago and other cities.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Operating under orders from U.S. President Donald Trump in summer 2020, federal agents used unmarked vehicles to "kidnap" Portland protesters and did not identify themselves as law enforcement during the apprehensions.

title: Is ICE 'Citizens Academy' Training Civilians To Arrest 'Undocumented' Immigrants?
subtitle: An ICE initiative in Chicago aims to "debunk myths" about the agency known for its detention centers and targeting of immigrant communities.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is planning a six-day “Citizens Academy” training, including instruction on firearms and how to make arrests, for Chicago residents in September 2020.

title: Did Disney 'Hire' Colin Kaepernick To 'Teach Your Kids About American History'?
subtitle: A production partnership sparked some unfounded claims about the former NFL player.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Disney "hired" Colin Kaepernick to "teach your kids about American history."

title: Did a 'Convicted Terrorist' Sit on the Board of a BLM Funding Body?
subtitle: The past crimes of Susan Rosenberg reemerged in the summer of 2020, amid a new wave of protests over racial injustice and police brutality.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Susan Rosenberg is a convicted terrorist who has sat on the board of directors of Thousand Currents, an organization which handles fundraising for the Black Lives Matter Global Network.

title: Will Soaking Strawberries in Saltwater Expose Fruit-Infesting Insects?
subtitle: Social media users posted videos showing insects crawling out of fruit after being soaked in warm, salty water.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: A saltwater solution will force insect pests out of infested strawberries.

title: Did the Merriam-Webster Dictionary Just Recognize 'Irregardless' as a Word?
subtitle: This long-used word has been the bane of many a pedant.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Merriam-Webster has recently included the word "irregardless" among its dictionary definitions.

title: Did California 'Forbid' Christians from Singing in Church?
subtitle: Safety guidelines for religious and cultural gatherings during the coronavirus pandemic got the political spin treatment.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: California's governor "forbids" Christians from singing in church during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.

title: Did a Florida Teen Die After Attending a Church 'COVID Party'?
subtitle: The tragic death of 17-year-old Carsyn Leigh Davis prompted controversy in July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Carsyn Leigh Davis died of COVID-19 shortly after attending a "COVID party" at her youth church.

title: Did Police in Riot Gear Disrupt a Violin Vigil for Elijah McClain?
subtitle: Video footage recorded at a vigil for Elijah McClain in Aurora, Colorado, caused widespread concern in June and July 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Police wearing riot gear in Aurora, Colorado disrupted a peaceful "violin vigil" in memory of Elijah McClain, in June 2020.

title: Did 'Racist Black Thugs Shoot a White Baby in the Face for the Fun of It'?
subtitle: The crime was horrific, but it was not an example of racial violence some reports made it out to be.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Two 'racist' Black teenagers shot and killed a white infant 'for the fun of it.'

title: Does the NFL Plan to Play the Black National Anthem Before Games?
subtitle: The idea was floated to several media outlets by an unnamed source who claims to have knowledge of the plan.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The NFL is planning to play "Lift Every Voice and Sing," also known as the Black national anthem, before games.

title: Did Mark McCloskey Donate to Democrats?
subtitle: After the couple pointed guns at protesters, rumors started to circulate about the McCloskeys' political affiliations.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Federal Election Commission records show that St. Louis attorney Mark McCloskey repeatedly donated to Democratic causes.

title: Could Mixing Dawn Dish Soap with Clorox Bleach Kill You?
subtitle: Public health officials urge against mixing cleaning products to avoid toxic results.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Dawn dish soap contains ammonia even though it's not listed as an ingredient, and when mixed with Clorox bleach products, the results could be lethal.

title: Did Ohio Police Pepper-Spray an Amputee Protester?
subtitle: Police brutality claims during a June 2020 rally against racism included rumors that officers forcibly removed a double amputee's prosthetics.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Police pepper-sprayed a double amputee and removed his prosthetic legs during a June 21, 2020, protest against police brutality in Columbus, Ohio.

title: Did Chick-fil-A CEO Say White People Should Shine Black People's Shoes?
subtitle: CEO Dan Cathy's alleged comments caused some blowback among his conservative audience.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Chick-fil-A CEO Dan Cathy said white people should shine the shoes of Black people in order to show shame about racism.

title: Did Pelosi Give George Floyd's Family a US Flag Meant To Honor Vets?
subtitle: The claim circulated after Floyd's brother called attention at a Congressional hearing to racism by American cops.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: On June 10, 2020, U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi presented Philonise Floyd, a brother to George Floyd, a folded American flag - a gesture that's exclusively for honoring veterans.

title: Did 5 Black Men Found Hanging Dead From Trees Die by Suicide?
subtitle: A meme surfaced amid international protests following the death of a Black man in police custody in Minneapolis.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Investigators initially ruled that five Black men found hanging dead from trees in the days following George Floyd's death on May 25, 2020 died by suicide.

title: Did L'Oréal Release a Statement Critiquing the 'Violent' White Race?
subtitle: The message went viral in June 2020, resulting in the hashtag #boycottloreal.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: L'Oréal Paris' adviser released an inflammatory statement saying white people's existence was "drenched in racism," and "their race is the most violent and oppressive force on earth."

title: Did Trump Say He Won't Leave Office at End of Elected Term?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald made the comments as part of a jab against his critics and journalists.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said he will not leave office at the end of his elected term.

title: Did Trump Say He Didn't Serve in Vietnam Because He Was 'Never a Fan'?
subtitle: A partial quote taken out of context can tell almost any story.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump stated he didn't serve in the Vietnam War because he was "never a fan" of it.

title: Did a Medical Manufacturer Destroy Swabs After Trump's Visit?
subtitle: Puritan Medical Products said the swabs had to be destroyed "due to the number of individuals (officials, security personnel, and media) participating in the visit."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A swab factory in Maine had to destroy medical supplies due to President Donald Trump's refusal to wear a mask during a visit.

title: Does This Old Picture Show Nancy Pelosi with JFK?
subtitle: A photograph circulating on social media shows U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi with President John F. Kennedy.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An old photograph shows U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi with President John F. Kennedy, with whom she supposedly "had an affair for seven long years."

title: Do Cosmetologists Require More Training Than Police?
subtitle: Contrasting the number of hours involved in two very different types of training is misleading.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Cosmetologists require many more hours of training than police officers.

title: Is the 'George Floyd Challenge' Real?
subtitle: A disturbing "challenge" featuring mostly young white men kneeling on each other's necks appears to mimic the death of George Floyd.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Using hashtags such as #GeorgeFloydChallenge, white people are taking part in a widespread effort in which they post photos of themselves kneeling on each other's necks to mimic or mock the death of George Floyd, a black man who died after a police officer kneeled on his neck.

title: Did a Protester Shoot a Las Vegas Cop During Civil Unrest in 2020?
subtitle: Or was the claim another case of online misinformation?
author: Jessica Lee
statement: During a demonstration against police brutality on June 1, 2020, a protester shot and wounded an officer with the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department.

title: Was Op-Ed by Hitler Published by New York Times in 1941?
subtitle: The publication of the dictator's piece on propaganda wasn't necessarily a tacit endorsement of it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The New York Times published an op-ed by Adolf Hitler in 1941.

title: Does This Flyer Accurately Represent Derek Chauvin's Police Actions?
subtitle: Here's what we know so far about the now-fired Minneapolis police officer who spurred protests in dozens of U.S. cities over racial disparities in policing in May 2020.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: A flyer circulating on the internet accurately describes the career of ex-Minneapolis police Officer Derek Chauvin.

title: Did George Floyd and Then-Officer Derek Chauvin Work Together in Minneapolis?
subtitle: Questions surfaced about the possibility that a Minneapolis police officer knew the man who died after the officer kneeled on his neck in May 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: George Floyd and then-Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin once worked together at a club and knew each other.

title: Did Trump and George Wallace Both Say, 'When the Looting Starts, the Shooting Starts'?
subtitle: The president's use of this infamous quote in May 2020 raised questions about its origins.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump and former Alabama Gov. George Wallace both used the phrase, "When the looting starts, the shooting starts."

title: Did Trump Say Cops Should 'Rough People Up' During Arrests?
subtitle: Comments the president made in 2017 resurfaced in May 2020 in the wake of the killing of George Floyd, a black man who died after a Minneapolis police officer kneeled on his neck.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In July 2017, U.S. President Donald Trump said police officers should "rough people up more" and not to worry about injuring suspects during arrests, effectively endorsing use of excessive force by cops.

title: Were 83 Ballots Fraudulently Mailed to One Calif. Home?
subtitle: Social media posts in May 2020 claimed the incident was an example of the ballot-casting system's vulnerability to voter fraud.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: In November 2016, 83 mail-in ballots were sent to a Los Angeles apartment where one person lives as part of an illegal scheme to cheat the elections system.

title: Were NY Nursing Homes Full of COVID-19 Patients While Hospital Ship Sat Empty?
subtitle: Bureaucratic hurdles appeared to have prevented a hospital ship in New York City from being fully used.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo ordered thousands of COVID-19 patients to be sent to nursing homes, while the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship sent to New York to help treat patients, sat empty and unused.

title: Did CDC Issue Strict Rules for Reopening Schools in Pandemic?
subtitle: A widely shared graphic paraphrased CDC recommendations that can be voluntarily adopted by schools during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The CDC issued a stringent set of rules that U.S. schools must follow before reopening amid the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.

title: Did 28 Million Mail-In Ballots Go 'Missing' in Last Four Elections?
subtitle: "Conflating voters choosing not to cast their ballot with 'missing' ballots is a fundamental flaw," a vote-at-home advocacy group argued.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In four elections from 2012 to 2018, an aggregate of 28 million mail-in ballots went "missing."

title: Are COVID-19 Tracing Apps Secretly Tracking Your Facebook and Phone Contacts?
subtitle: Two smartphone apps tracking the transmission of COVID-19 raised privacy questions ⁠- and where there are questions, there are usually rumors.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: COVID-19 contact-tracing apps like Healthy Together and ABTraceTogether are tracking you and also the people in your phone contacts and Facebook friends lists.

title: Did Gov. Cuomo Just Get a $71,000 Pay Raise?
subtitle: The New York governor was one of several state officials who were voted substantial, phased-in pay raises recommended by a compensation committee.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York recently received a little-publicized $71,000 pay raise that made him the highest paid governor in the U.S.

title: Is Kroger Requiring Employees to Repay Coronavirus Emergency Pay?
subtitle: An image showing a letter purportedly sent from the grocery chain to employees sparked outrage on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Supermarket retailer Kroger sent letters to employees informing them they must repay overpaid emergency pay provided amid the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.

title: Did Climate Activist Greta Thunberg Appear as Coronavirus 'Expert' on CNN Panel?
subtitle: The Swedish teenager and climate activist joined a guest line-up that included Major League Baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Teenage climate activist Greta Thunberg appeared on a CNN "expert panel" in a program about the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.

title: Did Carter Sell His Peanut Farm When He Became President?
subtitle: Social media users were back in the business of comparing presidential business practices in spring 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jimmy Carter sold his peanut farm before taking office as president in 1977.

title: Was a Woman Charged While Off-Duty Cop Who Killed Her Child Was Not?
subtitle: A meme provided some factual information, but also excluded many complexities in telling the story of a crash that left a 1-year-old dead.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A woman was charged with negligent homicide after a car traveling 94 MPH driven by an off-duty police officer crashed into the SUV in which she was riding and killed her infant daughter.

title: Is Hand Sanitizer Effective After Its Expiration Date?
subtitle: Questions about the longevity of hand sanitizers arose after the product started flying off store shelves during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: Hand sanitizers gradually become less effective after their expiration date.

title: Is This a 1918 Quarantine Ad for the Bell Telephone?
subtitle: We'll say this much: This is a real advertisement from the New York phone company.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A picture shows a 1918 advertisement touting the benefits of the Bell Telephone for maintaining relationships while people were under quarantine during the "Spanish flu."

title: Is This a 1962 Vision of Life in 2022?
subtitle: Imagine scooting around in something like a cross between the Segway and the Smart car.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An illustration from a 1962 Italian magazine shows an imagined scene from the year 2022.

title: Did Elon Musk Tweet a Dessert Picture from a Restaurant Amid COVID-19 Restrictions?
subtitle: He posted the photo of an ice cream sundae from Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant while stay-at-home orders were in effect.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Tesla entrepreneur and SpaceX founder Elon Musk tweeted a picture of a dessert from Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant with the comment "ice cream sundae in a martini glass."

title: Did the US Surgeon General Recommend the Public Not Wear Masks?
subtitle: Jerome Adams' comments from early 2020 were re-shared and went viral months after he changed his opinion about the benefit of wearing COVID-19 protective masks.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: U.S. Surgeon General Jerome Adams has said that the general public should not wear or buy masks to protect against the spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Did Woodstock Occur During a Pandemic as Lethal as COVID-19?
subtitle: Over the span of 18 months, the 1968 influenza pandemic killed approximately 100,000 people in the U.S.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The 1969 Woodstock music festival occurred during a pandemic as lethal as COVID-19.

title: Does H.R. 6666 Require People to Be Vaccinated for COVID-19?
subtitle: U.S. Rep. Bobby Rush's $100 billion grant program proposed in the H.R. 6666 TRACE bill has been widely misrepresented.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: H.R. 6666 provides $100 billion to entities that perform COVID-19 testing but prohibits them from allowing any non-vaccinated persons into their facilities.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict Events of 2020 Back in 1993?
subtitle: Coincidences that occur through the repetition of events are not necessarily the same thing as "predictions."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: "The Simpsons" television show predicted the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic and "murder wasp" incursion in a 1993 episode.

title: Are Dutch Restaurants Letting People Dine in Personal Pods During COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: One restaurant's proposed solution to dining out during the COVID-19 pandemic went viral on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dutch restaurants solved the problem of dining out during the COVID-19 coronavirus disease pandemic by installing personal greenhouse booths.

title: Is USPS Closing Soon Because of COVID-19?
subtitle: For many Americans who fear leaving their homes during the pandemic, the Postal Service is a lifeline.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: The U.S. economic downturn due to the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic in early 2020 was forcing the United States Postal Service to close.

title: Are US Citizens Married to Immigrants Excluded from COVID-19 Stimulus Checks?
subtitle: The answer, in part, depends on how couples filed their taxes.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. citizens married to immigrants will not receive stimulus checks via the March 2020 Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act.

title: Did Obama Admin Give Wuhan Laboratory a $3.7 Million Grant?
subtitle: While it isn't unusual to see international cooperation in the field of virology, this claim stretches the truth.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Obama administration provided a $3.7 million grant to the Wuhan Institute of Virology in China.

title: Do Bats on 2020 U.S. Quarters Demonstrate a Government COVID-19 Plot?
subtitle: Sometimes a bat is just a bat - even in American Samoa.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bats are pictured on the reverse of a U.S. quarter issued in 2020, an indicator that COVID-19 is connected to a government plot.

title: Did Trump Admin Give $55M to 'Bankrupt Company' for N95 Masks It Doesn't Make?
subtitle: FEMA stated it knows the company "doesn't make" the masks because the company is a broker, not a manufacturer.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trump administration awarded a $55 million contract to a "bankrupt company" with no employees to supply N95 masks that it doesn't make.

title: Are US Millionaires Receiving $1.7M in COVID-19 Stimulus Checks?
subtitle: That would be about 1,400 times the amount a low-income worker would receive from the federal government's COVID-19 economic relief package.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: U.S. millionaires will each receive an average of $1.7 million in stimulus payments via the March 2020 Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act.

title: Is Medicare Paying Hospitals $13K for Patients Diagnosed with COVID-19, $39K for Those on Ventilators?
subtitle: Questions were raised on cable news about whether hospitals have financial incentives to diagnose patients with COVID-19.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Medicare is paying hospitals $13,000 for patients admitted with COVID-19 diagnoses and $39,000 if those patients are placed on ventilators.

title: Did Lack of Social Distancing in 1918 Pandemic Cause More Deaths Than WWI?
subtitle: A viral meme about the "Spanish flu" pandemic gets some general points right, but the presented timeline is inaccurate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: People started to ignore social distancing rules during the 1918 pandemic, leading to a second wave of infections that killed more people than all of World War I.

title: Did Pelosi Delete a Tweet That Showed Her Promoting Chinatown Tourism?
subtitle: A snarky tweet about the U.S. House Speaker from the president took aim at her February 2020 visit to San Francisco.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. Rep. Nancy Pelosi's Twitter account deleted a tweet showing her encouraging tourism to Chinatown weeks after President Donald Trump closed the U.S. border to China.

title: Did Dr. Fauci Say There Was 'Nothing to Worry About' in Regards to COVID-19?
subtitle: Accusations that Dr. Anthony Fauci said it was "safe" to go to the movies and gym in late February 2020 ignored key facts about the coronavirus outbreak at that time.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Dr. Anthony Fauci said there was "nothing to worry about" in late February 2020 in regards to COVID-19 and it was "safe" to do things like go to the movies and the gym.

title: Did All Vegas Hotels Except Trump's Donate Rooms for COVID-19 First Responders?
subtitle: That would be a lot of hotels.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: All hotels in Las Vegas have made donations to help emergency personnel in the city except for one: Trump International Hotel.

title: Does Ivanka Trump Hold a Trademark on Coffins in China?
subtitle: In 2018, the United States' first daughter was awarded a variety of trademarks.
author: Dan Evon
statement: First daughter Ivanka Trump was granted a trademark on coffins in China and stands to profit from the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Are the Himalayas Visible from Northern India for First Time in 30 Years?
subtitle: Pollution levels in India did drop dramatically in April 2020, but beyond that the story gets a little more hazy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: In April 2020, the Himalayas were visible from northern India for the first time in 30 years.

title: Have Plagues Repeated Exactly Every 100 Years?
subtitle: The predictive value of cherry-picked data is generally low to insignificant.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme documents that plagues occur every 100 years.

title: Did Uninsured Teen Die of COVID-19 After Being Denied Treatment?
subtitle: A story that went viral was later clarified with regard to key details.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An uninsured 17-year-old boy died of COVID-19 symptoms after being refused care due to a lack of medical insurance.

title: Did the Kennedy Center Donate Stimulus Money to the DNC?
subtitle: A viral meme suggested the performing arts center "laundered" money for the DNC instead of paying Center employees.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts "laundered" coronavirus-relief money by donating to the Democratic National Committee even after cutting off musician pay.

title: Did Trump Say Governors Had To Treat Him Well To Get COVID-19 Supplies?
subtitle: A statement by the president was misleadingly represented in a quote meme.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said state governors must "treat me well" in order to obtain masks and ventilators from federal reserves.

title: Is Hobby Lobby Refusing To Close Stores Because of a Message from God?
subtitle: Hobby Lobby reportedly sent a letter to employees explaining its stores were staying open during the COVID-19 pandemic because, in part, CEO David Green's wife had received reassurances from God.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Hobby Lobby CEO David Green is refusing to close stores during the COVID-19 pandemic because his wife, Barbara, received a message from God saying that employees would be kept safe.

title: Was Obama Responsible for N95 Masks Shortage?
subtitle: As the COVID-19 pandemic ratcheted up in the United States, so did partisan finger-pointing.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former President Barack Obama's administration was to blame for the shortage of protective equipment like N95 respirator masks in the early months of the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Is COVID-19 Being Spread Through Gas Pumps?
subtitle: Gas pump handles are one of many common objects that could be contaminated, so consumers should take reasonable precautions to avoid exposure.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The COVID-19 coronavirus disease is "spreading quickly from gas pumps."

title: Did Dolphins and Swans 'Return' to Italian Waterways Amid COVID-19 Lockdown?
subtitle: A few wildlife sightings were excitedly shared across social media as a note of sunny news amid the bleak reality of the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Amid a nationwide COVID-19 lockdown, Italians reported seeing wildlife such as swans and dolphins "returning" to newly tranquil waterways, ports, and canals.

title: Is McDonald's Giving Free Lunches to School Kids During Pandemic?
subtitle: A few McDonald's locations in the U.S. made a major announcement about kids' meals.
author: Dan Evon
statement: McDonald's is giving free lunches to school-age children during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Does This Phone Number Connect with United Way's COVID-19 Relief Fund?
subtitle: Financial assistance related to COVID-19 issues may be available, but applicants must be sure to connect with the proper local agency.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The phone number 1-866-211-9966 connects callers with the United Way's COVID-19 Community Economic Relief Fund.

title: Did US 'Refuse' COVID-19 Testing Kits from the World Health Organization?
subtitle: Criticism over the failure to conduct immediate, widespread coronavirus testing in the U.S. focused on the availability of test kits from the WHO.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The United States "refused" COVID-19 diagnostic tests offered by the World Health Organization.

title: Could the 2020 U.S. Presidential Election Be Postponed?
subtitle: Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night - nor a pandemic - has much chance of delaying a presidential election.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The 2020 U.S. presidential election could be postponed if the coronavirus pandemic threatens to keep people from voting.

title: Does Jared Kushner's Brother Own a Company Involved in COVID-19 Testing?
subtitle: Oscar, a digital health-insurance startup that recently set up a service for users to find COVID-19 testing centers, was co-founded by Joshua Kushner.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Jared Kushner's brother, Joshua Kushner, owns a company involved in COVID-19 testing.

title: Has Italy Stopped Treating the Elderly in the COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: A viral social media post claimed Italian doctors were not treating older patients with coronavirus due to "socialized medicine."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Italy has stopped treating elderly coronavirus patients due to "socialized medicine."

title: Can You Get a Free Coronavirus Test by Donating Blood?
subtitle: Some blood banks have begun routinely conducting COVID-19 antibody tests on donors' blood, though this is not the same thing as diagnostic testing for the disease.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donating blood requires that you be administered a free test for COVID-19, a disease caused by the coronavirus.

title: Does Johns Hopkins University's Coronavirus Map Contain Malware?
subtitle: Malicious actors often attempt to spread malware by disguising it as information from credible sources.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A map from Johns Hopkins University that shows the spread of COVID-19 contains malware.

title: Did Self-Described Psychic Sylvia Browne Predict the Coronavirus?
subtitle: Lobbing vague claims about likely events does not a prediction make.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Self-described psychic Sylvia Browne "predicted" a 2020 outbreak of the new coronavirus.

title: Did President Trump Refer to the Coronavirus as a 'Hoax'?
subtitle: Trump's commentary on the new coronavirus came before the virus began killing patients in the U.S.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump referred to the new coronavirus as a "hoax."

title: Did the 8 Largest Single-Day Stock Drops Occur Under Trump?
subtitle: As is often the case with statistics, which ones you choose to consider makes a significant difference.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The eight largest single-day drops in the Dow Jones Industrial Average have occurred under the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Did President Trump Cut the CDC Budget?
subtitle: As the new coronavirus spread in February 2020, so did concerns about the United States' readiness to respond to the outbreak.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump cut funding for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

title: Is Coronavirus Spreading Faster Than SARS, Ebola, and Swine Flu?
subtitle: A video clip supposedly showing the exponential spread of a new coronavirus misled some viewers.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video demonstrates there have been exponentially more cases of new coronavirus than other diseases such as SARS, MERS, Ebola, and swine flu.

title: Does Map of Missing Persons in US Match Up with Cave Systems?
subtitle: With some additional context, this coincidence doesn't seem quite as spooky.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A comparison of two maps shows how most people in the United States seem to go missing near cave systems.

title: Did US 'Lead the World' in Reducing CO2 Emissions in 2019?
subtitle: Right-leaning websites celebrated the findings of a February 2020 report by the International Energy Agency.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2019 the United States "led the world" in reducing carbon dioxide emissions.

title: Would an Alabama Bill Require Men Over 50 to Get Vasectomies?
subtitle: Sometimes legislation is created simply to protest other legislation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A bill introduced to the Alabama Legislature would require a man to undergo a vasectomy within one month of his 50th birthday.

title: Is This 'God Bows Down to Trump' Sign Real?
subtitle: Political humor can sometimes be so arch that viewers fail to discern it as such.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a real a Trump 2020 campaign sign bearing the legend "God Bows Down to President Donald J Trump - Declares 'He Is Perfect.'"

title: Was a Suitcase Full of Dead Birds from China Seized at Dulles Airport?
subtitle: A relatively mundane incident went viral due in part to rising fears about an outbreak of a new coronavirus.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A traveler from Beijing was caught at Dulles International Airport with a suitcase full of dead birds that the person tried to disguise as pet food.

title: Did a 'Russian-Linked Oligarch' Fund Pete Buttigieg's Presidential Campaign?
subtitle: A billionaire with dual U.S. and U.K. citizenship gave $5,200 to Buttigieg's campaign, among other donations.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: "Russian-linked oligarch" Len Blavatnik donated to Pete Buttigieg's 2020 U.S. presidential campaign.

title: Did Democrats Really Do All of This?
subtitle: A meme presented kernels of truth within a distorted, oversimplified story line.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: As stated in a meme, "Democrats killed a bill for tuition assistance for children of veterans killed in battle, THEN APPROVE subsidizing the education and healthcare of 'Ilegal Immigrants.'"

title: Was Bill Clinton Forced to Testify at His Impeachment Trial?
subtitle: What are the rules, how do they apply, and to whom?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Bill Clinton was forced to testify at his 1999 U.S. Senate impeachment trial.

title: Did Boko Haram Behead a Nigerian Pastor After He 'Refused to Deny Christ'?
subtitle: Readers inquired about the details surrounding the horrific execution of the Rev. Lawan Andimi in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2020, Boko Haram executed pastor Lawan Andimi as a result, at least in part, of his refusal to renounce his Christian faith.

title: Did Trump Adviser Paula White Pray for All 'Satanic Pregnancies' to Be Terminated?
subtitle: The controversial televangelist engendered criticism and controversy for remarks she made during a church service in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In January 2020, Paula White prayed for all "satanic pregnancies" to "miscarry right now."

title: Did Harvard Pay Elizabeth Warren $400,000 to Teach One Class?
subtitle: An old tweet, accusing the Massachusetts senator of hypocrisy, re-emerged during the 2020 Democratic presidential primary.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Harvard University paid Elizabeth Warren $400,000 to teach one class.

title: Is the Subaru 'F.U.C.K.S.' Model a Real Car?
subtitle: The Subaru Forester Ultimate Customized Kit Special edition was on display at the 2020 Singapore Motor Show.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Subaru released a new car model with the acronym F.U.C.K.S.

title: Did Nancy Pelosi 'Admit' She Began Impeachment Two Years Ago?
subtitle: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi appeared to lump the beginning of the Mueller investigation in with the impeachment timeline.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi "admitted" she began impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump 2 1/2 years ago.

title: Are Wombats Inviting Animals Into Their Burrows to Escape Australia Fires?
subtitle: Gather 'round to hear the tale of the wombat hero ... or at least the wombat's big burrow.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Wombats are herding animals and inviting them into their burrows in order to escape the wildfires in Australia.

title: Can Amazon's Alexa Tell You How to Do CPR in an Emergency?
subtitle: In the event of an emergency, you should definitely call emergency responders.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Amazon's personal-assistant Alexa can give CPR instructions in an emergency.

title: Did Vermont Outlaw Anyone Under Age 21 from Owning a Cellphone?
subtitle: Any legislator can write legislation, but that doesn't mean it will become law.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The state of Vermont made it illegal to own a cellphone for anyone under age 21.

title: Did CNN Settle the Covington High Lawsuit for $275 Million?
subtitle: The details of a settlement reached between student Nick Sandmann and CNN have not been made public.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: CNN settled a lawsuit with Covington Catholic High School student Nick Sandmann, paying out $275 million.

title: Did Iran Offer an $80M Bounty for Trump's Head?
subtitle: The amount of the bounty is supposedly based on Iran's population.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Iran has offered an $80M bounty for the head of U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Does This Map Show Human Trafficking Hotspots in U.S.?
subtitle: The three most common types of sex trafficking are escort services, residential (locations), and outdoor solicitations.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A map shows the portions of the U.S. that have the greatest incidence of human trafficking.

title: Is This an Authentic John Wesley 'Manifesto'?
subtitle: Facebook users widely shared a list of principles that some claimed was a "manifesto" written by the 18th-century theologian.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A list of principles shared on social media in late 2019 was a manifesto written by 18th-century theologian John Wesley.

title: Did Mike Pompeo Say on Russian State TV that the CIA 'Lied, Cheated, Stole'?
subtitle: Context always matters - including location.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo stated on the Russian state television network RT that the CIA "lied, cheated, stole."

title: Was Donald Trump Cut from 'Home Alone 2' for Political Reasons?
subtitle: Standard TV disclaimer: "This film has been modified from its original version. It has been formatted to fit this screen and edited for content."
author: Dan Evon
statement: The CBC cut a scene featuring Donald Trump from its December 2019 broadcast of the movie "Home Alone 2" for political reasons.

title: Did an Iowa Man Get 16 Years in Prison for Burning an LGBT Rainbow Flag?
subtitle: In December 2019, several news reports failed to properly explain to readers the impact of "habitual offender" laws on prison sentences.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In December 2019, an Ames, Iowa, man was given a 16-year prison sentence for burning an LGBT rainbow flag.

title: Did the US List Fictional Wakanda as a Trading Partner?
subtitle: That the nation is fictional and its precise location unknown is apparently no barrier to free trade.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.S. listed the fictional country of Wakanda as a trading partner.

title: Was Trump Impeached With More Votes Than Any Other US President?
subtitle: While this is technically true, it's missing some important context.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump was impeached with more votes than any other president in American history.

title: Did Trump Propose SSI Changes That Could End Disability Benefits for Thousands?
subtitle: Activists and Congressional Democrats encouraged the public to voice their opposition to the proposals, which were published in November 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A November 2019 Trump administration proposal would end Social Security disability payments for thousands of recipients.

title: Are Praying Mantis Eggs Commonly Found on Christmas Trees?
subtitle: We'll say this: The praying mantis is not preying on humans in any way.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Praying mantis eggs are commonly found on Christmas trees.

title: Did Pope Francis Compare President Trump to King Herod?
subtitle: Herod the Great ordered the "massacre of the Innocents" in the Gospel according to Matthew.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pope Francis compared U.S. President Donald Trump to King Herod.

title: Did Trump Say 'Hillary Clinton Can't Satisfy Her Husband'?
subtitle: The line between original speech and mere repetition is frequently blurred in the online world.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump once said, "If Hillary Clinton can't satisfy her husband what makes her think she can satisfy America?"

title: Did Willie Nelson Quit Smoking Weed?
subtitle: His spokeswoman noted he does whatever he wants when it comes to smoking anything.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Country music singer Willie Nelson stopped smoking weed.

title: Did Zelensky Say Trump 'Did Nothing Wrong' In Relation to Ukraine?
subtitle: The U.S. president engaged in some wishful thinking about a major interview his Ukrainian counterpart gave in December 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky said in December 2019 that U.S. President Donald Trump had "done nothing wrong" with regard to Ukraine.

title: Did Amazon Sell Auschwitz-Themed Christmas Ornaments?
subtitle: It's not the first time Amazon has come under scrutiny for items sold on its site.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Amazon sold Christmas ornaments with images of the Nazi death camp Auschwitz on them.

title: Did Marilyn Monroe Help Ella Fitzgerald Book Mocambo Gig?
subtitle: The actress reportedly pushed the popular music club to book Fitzgerald, but a viral photograph of the famous pair is often shared with inaccurate context.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Mocambo night club in Los Angeles refused to book Ella Fitzgerald due to her race but was eventually persuaded to do so by actress Marilyn Monroe.

title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict the Censorship of Michelangelo's 'David'?
subtitle: A case of life imitating art imitating life.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a 1990 episode, "The Simpsons" predicted future real-life campaigns to censor and cover up replicas of Michelangelo's "David" statue.

title: Are Child Miners Exploited to Manufacture Electric Car Batteries?
subtitle: The use of child labor to extract cobalt from mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo is certainly a major problem.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Electric car manufacturers rely on child labor to extract cobalt for their car batteries.

title: Was a Man Wearing a 'Retired Police Officer' Shirt Denied Entry at Universal Orlando?
subtitle: A statement from the famed theme park indicated it has a dress policy to avoid confusion.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Universal Orlando Resort stopped a retired police officer from entering the theme park because his T-shirt said "Retired Police Officer" on it.

title: Did Chick-fil-A Stop Donations to Groups Criticized as Anti-LGBT?
subtitle: News reports left out important context about a major announcement by the fast food giant in November 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In November 2019, Chick-fil-A announced it would no longer provide charitable donations to Christian groups criticized as being anti-LGBT.

title: Did Trump and Nixon Say They Attack Journalists to Destroy Their Credibility?
subtitle: It's definitely fair to say that U.S. Presidents Donald Trump and Richard Nixon were not fans of a free press.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Presidents Donald Trump and Richard Nixon both said that their attacks on journalists were designed to destroy the credibility of news stories.

title: Is 'Juice-Jacking' via Public USB Ports a Real Security Threat?
subtitle: While "juice-jacking" is technically possible, the criminal practice doesn't appear to be widespread.
author: Dan Evon
statement: People should avoid plugging their phones into a public USB port due to a security threat called "juice-jacking."

title: Was Donald Trump Fined for 'Stealing' Money Intended for Veterans?
subtitle: Social media posts and memes badly misrepresented the facts surrounding the November 2019 resolution of a high-profile lawsuit against the president.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The New York Supreme Court ordered President Donald Trump to pay $2 million as punishment for "stealing" charitable donations intended for veterans groups.

title: Did White House Press Secretary Stephanie Grisham Get Two DUIs, in 2013 and 2015?
subtitle: Grisham's past brushes with the law became the focus of social media scrutiny in October and November 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Stephanie Grisham got DUIs in 2013 and 2015.

title: Did This Old Fire Alarm Box Lock Pranksters in Place?
subtitle: A photograph of an old fire alarm box is real but is frequently shared without proper context.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An old photograph shows a fire alarm box equipped with an anti-prank mechanism that locks the alarm sender in place until authorities arrive.

title: Did No US Flags Adorn the Stage at the Detroit Democratic Debate?
subtitle: Memes remain a poor source when it comes to facts.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: No American flags adorned the stage at a debate for Democratic presidential candidates in Detroit in 2019.

title: Were More Hunting Licenses Sold in US Than Number of Soldiers in World's Biggest Armies?
subtitle: We're not exactly sure how these two figures are related.
author: Dan Evon
statement: More hunting licenses were sold in the United States last year than the number of soldiers in the world's 10 largest armies.

title: Is a New STD Superbug Deadlier Than AIDS?
subtitle: A worrisome report from 2013 generated new fears several years later.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Health officials warned that a new STD superbug could be deadlier than AIDS.

title: Was Lt. Col. Vindman 'Fired' from the National Security Council?
subtitle: An interview response by National Security Advisor Robert O'Brien left people confused about Vindman's status at the NSC.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: National Security Advisor Robert C. O'Brien said that Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman was being removed from the NSC.

title: Did Elizabeth Warren's Campaign Say Mark Zuckerberg Had Endorsed Trump?
subtitle: The Massachusetts senator's presidential campaign got creative in criticizing the spread of political misinformation on Facebook.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. Sen. Elizabeth Warren's presidential campaign claimed in October 2019 that Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg had endorsed President Donald Trump for re-election.

title: Did Eisenhower Say 'If You Want Total Security, Go to Prison'?
subtitle: A paraphrase of the five-star general's comments was used in a meme about "socialism."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Dwight D. Eisenhower said "If you want total security, go to prison."

title: Did CVS Refuse Customer's Puerto Rican Driver's License, Demand Citizenship Docs?
subtitle: An apparently isolated incident in Indiana resulted in a storm of internet outrage.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A CVS drug store refused a customer's Puerto Rican driver's license when he was asked to show ID and demanded immigration papers.

title: Was Trump Caught on Leaked Recording Threatening Ukraine Whistleblower With Death?
subtitle: The ominous remarks were also pretty vague.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump threatened the Ukraine whistleblower, and the person who supplied the whistleblower with information, with death.

title: Are These Photos from Life Magazine's 'Guide to Kissing'?
subtitle: Kissing is one of many tasks that actors and actresses are asked to perform on stage.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A set of photographs was originally published in Life magazine's "Guide to Kissing" in 1942.

title: Is This a Picture of Tulsi Gabbard with Antifa?
subtitle: Gabbard, a 2020 Democratic presidential candidate, met with a number of veterans during the Standing Rock protests in 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Tulsi Gabbard with members of Antifa, including political activist Evan Duke.

title: Did Trans Activists 'Force' Procter & Gamble to Remove Female Symbol from Some Period Products?
subtitle: Tabloid newspapers and right-leaning websites distorted a decision to make Always packaging trans-inclusive.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2019, trans activists or "the transgender lobby" forced Procter & Gamble to remove the Venus symbol from menstruation products.

title: Is this a GIF of a Snail Watching a Race Car Drift on a Road?
subtitle: A viral clip supposedly showed the start of a real-world version of the movie "Turbo."
author: Dan Evon
statement: An animated GIF shows a snail watching a race car drift around a bend in a road.

title: Is Turkey Holding 50 US Nuclear Weapons 'Hostage'?
subtitle: A metaphorical reference has been taken literally by some.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Turkish President Erdogan is holding 50 American nuclear weapons "hostage."

title: Has Trump Spent '278.5 Years' of Salary on Taxpayer-Funded Golf Outings?
subtitle: The president of the United States is paid $400,000 a year.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Trump has spent 278.5 years of presidential salary funded by taxpayers on golf outings.

title: Did Chick-fil-A Help Fund an Anti-LGBT Death Penalty Law in Uganda?
subtitle: Viral tweets and Facebook posts drew a direct link between buying chicken sandwiches and killing LGBT people.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In October 2019, Chick-fil-A's charitable donations were contributing to efforts to introduce the death penalty for homosexuality in Uganda.

title: Did Red Bull Stand With Hong Kong Protesters in New Ad?
subtitle: The beverage company has previously released advertisements in support of civilian protests.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Red Bull released an advertisement in October 2019 in support of pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong.

title: Did China Grant a Trademark to Ivanka Trump for Voting Machines?
subtitle: The first daughter said in 2018 that she would be closing down her business to focus on her work in Washington.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: China has granted a trademark for Ivanka Trump-branded voting machines.

title: Was an NFL Player Fined for Wearing a 'Man of God' Headband?
subtitle: The NFL is well known for strictly enforcing their very detailed dress code.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New Orleans Saints linebacker Demario Davis was fined by the NFL for wearing a "Man of God" headband.

title: Did an AOC Supporter Suggest 'Eating Babies' to Fight Climate Change?
subtitle: The bizarre statement came up at a New York City town hall event in October 2019.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A supporter of U.S. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez suggested eating babies to combat climate change at a town hall event.

title: Did Iran Pass a Law Allowing Men to Marry Their Daughters?
subtitle: An Indian website muddied an already confusing issue about marriage in Iran by republishing a several-year-old article without attribution.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Iran recently passed a law allowing men to marry their daughters.

title: Was a Baby Born Alive at 23 Weeks 'Thrown in the Trash'?
subtitle: Pro-life commentators highlighted the 2006 Florida case of Sycloria Williams in September 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2006, an abortion-clinic owner cut the umbilical cord of a baby born alive before "throwing" her in a biohazard bag and putting her remains in "the trash."

title: Was Betsy Ross a Quaker Who Was Opposed to Slavery?
subtitle: The so-called "Betsy Ross flag" has become a recent point of controversy in connection with white supremacy and raised questions about Ross herself.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Betsy Ross made the first American flag (or one of the first American flags), known as the "Betsy Ross flag," and was a Quaker who opposed slavery.

title: Did Tanya McDowell Get 5 Years for Sending Her Son to a Better School While Felicity Huffman Got 14 Days?
subtitle: Memes comparing Tanya McDowell to various school-related criminal cases surface frequently.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Did Tanya McDowell get five years in prison for sending her son to a better school, while actress Felicity Huffman got 14 days in prison for paying to have her daughter's SAT scores inflated in what has become known as the college-admissions cheating scandal.

title: Decades in Prison for Selling Weed, 5 Years' Probation for Raping a Child?
subtitle: A widely shared meme compared the crimes and punishments of Michael Alonzo Thompson and Joseph Robert Meili.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Michael Alonzo Thompson was imprisoned for decades for selling marijuana, while Joseph Robert Meili got five years' probation for kidnapping and raping an 11-year-old girl.

title: Did a Swedish Scientist Propose Cannibalism as a Solution to Climate Change?
subtitle: News websites seized upon remarks made by Magnus Söderlund in September 2019, but climate skepticism (and a language barrier) may have caused confusion.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Magnus Söderlund proposed or advocated eating human flesh as a solution to climate change in remarks he made on Sept. 3, 2019.

title: Did Pepsi Admit Aquafina Is Just Tap Water?
subtitle: The water used in many bottled-water products comes from municipal water supplies.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Pepsi admitted that Aquafina is just tap water.

title: Did Canadian Man With ALS Choose Assisted Suicide After Being Denied Adequate Care?
subtitle: Pro-life websites reported - with a degree of accuracy - on the difficult case of Sean Tagert.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Sean Tagert's decision to obtain a physician-assisted suicide was caused, in part or in whole, by a regional health authority's failure to provide what he regarded as necessary care.

title: Were Bahamians Fleeing Dorian Told to Leave a Ferry to Florida Because They Lacked Visas?
subtitle: The answer had to do with confusion and miscommunication rather than new visa requirements.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Bahamians fleeing the destruction of Hurricane Dorian in late summer 2019 were forced to leave a boat to the U.S. because they didn't have visas.

title: Was Mike Pence Greeted by a Widespread Display of LGBT Rainbow Flags in Iceland?
subtitle: The U.S. vice president was met with protests on visits to two European countries in September 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence was greeted by a widespread display of LGBT rainbow flags on his visit to Reykjavík, Iceland, in September 2019.

title: Did Two Women Sue a Water Park for Injuries After Breaking into It?
subtitle: Don't sue summer ... or any of the other seasons.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Two women entered a closed amusement park and then sued its operators after injuring themselves while improperly self-operating an attraction.

title: Does This Social Media Narrative Describe Volunteers Helping with Hurricane Dorian?
subtitle: The Cajun Navy 2016 are second responders from Louisiana who offer volunteer assistance during hurricanes.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A social media post describes volunteers headed to Florida to help with Hurricane Dorian relief in September 2019.

title: Did Joe Biden Tell a False Story About a War Hero?
subtitle: Some key details of an incident that happened in 2011 were wrong, but the central aspects of the story Biden told weren't false.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden told a "false" or "fabricated" story about a war hero while on the campaign trail.

title: Does a Video Show a Dangerous Worm in a Bell Pepper?
subtitle: An unappetizing video clip went viral in August 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A video shared widely in August 2019 shows a dangerous type of worm inside of a bell pepper.

title: Will Children of U.S. Troops Born Overseas No Longer Get U.S. Citizenship?
subtitle: News outlets have reported conflicting information about new USCIS guidance involving children born to U.S. government employees.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Children born to U.S. service members and government employees overseas will no longer be automatically considered citizens of the United States.

title: Did a Fox News Guest Refer to 'Shooting Up' Marijuana?
subtitle: Marijuana is typically smoked or consumed.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Fox News guest referred to people injecting marijuana into their systems.

title: Is CVS a Major Donor to Trump's 2020 Reelection Campaign?
subtitle: CVS corporate and its associated PAC contributed $535,000 in donations in 2017 to political organizations that support Trump.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The pharmacy-store chain CVS is a "major donor" to U.S. President Donald Trump's 2020 reelection campaign.

title: Are Surplus Apples Hung for Free From Fences in Norway to Feed the Hungry?
subtitle: One woman's kindness sparked rumors about the harvesting habits of an entire country.
author: Dan Evon
statement: It's common practice in Norway to give away surplus apples to help feed the hungry by hanging them in bags from a fence.

title: Did a Trump Official Move to Change the Poem on the Statue of Liberty?
subtitle: The sonnet on the Statue of Liberty welcomes the "huddled masses."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Trump administration official moved to change the poem inscribed on the base of the Statue of Liberty in New York.

title: Is 'Cum Park Plaza' a Real Place?
subtitle: How many crude jokes can be stuffed into a single image?
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows a sign for the "Cum Park Plaza" shopping center.

title: Did Trump Brag About Crowd Sizes While Past Presidents Consoled Massacre Victims?
subtitle: An Occupy Democrats meme quoted four presidents accurately, but misled readers by cherry-picking an especially bad moment for U.S. President Donald Trump.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the aftermath of two mass shootings, President Donald Trump attacked a political opponent and bragged about crowd sizes during remarks about the incidents, whereas past presidents offered words of comfort and solidarity.

title: Did an Illinois Goodwill Fire Its Disabled Workers?
subtitle: A local news report and viral Facebook post omitted crucial information about a plan to "pull paychecks" from disabled workers at the Land of Lincoln Goodwill.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In the summer of 2019, the Land of Lincoln Goodwill organization ended the paid employment of disabled workers.

title: Did Bernie Sanders 'Pledge to Reveal Info on Aliens If He Wins in 2020'?
subtitle: Quoting his wife: "Bernie, what's going on?  Do you have any access to records?"
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. 2020 presidential candidate Bernie Sanders 'pledged to reveal info on aliens' if he won the 2020 election.

title: Does a Meme Show the Faces of Suspected Mass Shooters in U.S. in 2019?
subtitle: After two shooting massacres in August 2019 in the U.S., some commentators focused on the racial identities of perpetrators.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A widely shared meme in August 2019 showed the faces of known mass-shooting suspects in the U.S. in 2019.

title: Did the U.S. Have 251 Mass Shootings in the First 216 Days of 2019?
subtitle: The number of mass shootings varies greatly depending on how such shootings are defined.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The United States had 251 mass shootings during the first 216 days of 2019.

title: Was the El Paso Shooting Suspect's MyLife Page Altered by 'Leftists'?
subtitle: Pranksters and critics play politics with online info in the wake of a mass shooting.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The El Paso shooting suspect's MyLife page was altered by 'Leftists' to make him appear to be a Republican.

title: Did This Photograph Appear on the El Paso Mall Shooter's Twitter Page?
subtitle: Social media accounts are typically scrutinized for clues to the motivations of mass shooters.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph found in the El Paso mall shooter's Twitter account shows "Trump" spelled out in firearms.

title: Did U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar Say 'Our Country Should Be More Fearful of White Men'?
subtitle: Attacks on Omar have frequently taken her comments out of context to paint them in an inflammatory light.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar said "our country should be more fearful of white men."

title: Is This 'Zombie Chicken' Video Real?
subtitle: Ikizukuri is the preparation of sashimi from live seafood.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a piece of raw chicken meat "twitching" off of a dinner table.

title: If You Used FaceApp, Do Russians Now Own All of Your Photographs?
subtitle: Users should always consider privacy and security before uploading personal data to an app.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: If you did the "age challenge" and used FaceApp to upload your picture, Russians now own all of your photographs.

title: Did Rep. Frederica Wilson Advocate Prosecuting People Who 'Make Fun' of Congress?
subtitle: Context is key, which is why politically-slanted reporting frequently omits it.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Rep. Frederica Wilson advocated prosecuting persons who "make fun of Congress" online.

title: Did a City in Ilhan Omar's District Eliminate the Pledge of Allegiance at Council Meetings?
subtitle: Headlines attempted to connect the factual actions of a local Minnesota city council to U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar, despite her being wholly uninvolved.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A city in U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar's congressional district voted to eliminate the pledge of allegiance before city council meetings.

title: Was an 'Elderly Man' Beaten While Trying to Help a 'Man in a Sundress' in Portland?
subtitle: An image of an older man with a bloody face was widely shared, but video shows he was an aggressor in a brawl.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An "elderly man" was beaten while trying to protect a sundress-wearing man from being attacked.

title: Did a Pride Flag Replace a POW/MIA Flag at Veterans Memorial Plaza?
subtitle: Oddly, most of the outrage over this incident came after the problem had been fixed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A pride flag replaced a POW/MIA flag at a Veterans Memorial Plaza in Maryland.

title: Did J.K. Rowling 'Confirm Her Stance Against Transgender Women'?
subtitle: A thought-provoking, widely shared blog post made a series of allegations against the "Harry Potter" creator in June 2019. Six months later, the author broke her conspicuous silence on trans issues.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In June 2019, J.K. Rowling definitively confirmed her antipathy towards trans women and/or opposition to trans inclusion.

title: Did an Ala. Court Force Rape Survivor to Allow Rapist to Visit Their Children?
subtitle: Multiple news articles in June 2019 prompted reader inquiries about the plight of Jessica Stallings and her children in Alabama.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2018 or 2019, an Alabama court ordered a rape survivor named Jessica Stallings to allow her rapist to visit the children who were born to them.

title: Did Trump Campaign Offer Actors $50 to Cheer Him at Prez Announcement?
subtitle: The Trump campaign denied knowing a contractor hired a casting agency for the candidate's 2015 campaign-announcement rally.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Trump campaign offered actors $50 each to cheer him on at his 2015 presidential-campaign announcement.

title: Was Frank 'Rocky' Fiegel the Inspiration for 'Popeye'?
subtitle: According to local folklore, "Popeye the Sailor Man" was based on a real-life person from Chester, Ill.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Frank "Rocky" Fiegel, a real-life person who served as the inspiration for the character "Popeye."

title: Does an X-Ray Show Hundreds of Bubble Tea Pearls in a Teen's Stomach?
subtitle: We were able to loosen up some information about this image with the help of the American Gastroenterological Association.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An X-ray shows hundreds of bubble tea pearls inside a teenage girl's stomach.

title: Is the Trump Administration Denying U.S. Citizenship to Children of Same-Sex Couples?
subtitle: A U.S. State Department policy blocking birthright citizenship for some children born to U.S. citizens abroad via assisted reproductive technology has been in place for more than a decade.
author: David Emery
statement: The Trump administration is denying citizenship to some children born on foreign soil to same-sex couples.

title: Did Abraham Lincoln Say 'America Will Never Be Destroyed From the Outside'?
subtitle: Widely shared memes contained a quotation that is commonly attributed to the Great Emancipator.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Did Abraham Lincoln proclaim that 'America will never be destroyed from the outside'?

title: 40 Years in Prison for Selling Cannabis, 17 Years for Joining the Taliban?
subtitle: A meme compared the sentences given to John Walker Lindh, a white American known as the "American Taliban," and black Michigan resident Michael Alonzo Thompson.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: We break down the factual claims made by the "Other 98%" about the cases of John Walker Lindh and Michael Alonzo Thompson.

title: Did Statesville, NC, Try to Stop Camping World from Flying the U.S. Flag?
subtitle: The company's CEO Marcus Lemonis told Snopes.com, "We will not be taking the flag down under any circumstances ... Never going to happen."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In May 2019, the city of Statesville, N.C., filed for a court injunction to force Camping World to remove an American flag from their local branch.

title: Did the FBI Discover a 'Homegrown Islamic Terror Compound' in Alabama?
subtitle: Reports emerged in spring 2019 that linked a 2-acre plot of land near Tuskegee with a bizarre, sprawling terrorism and kidnapping investigation.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: The FBI discovered a terrorist compound in Alabama, as reported in May 2019.

title: Did U.S. Presidential Candidate Joe Biden Say He Had 'No Empathy' for the Plight of Younger People?
subtitle: A January 2018 video of the former U.S. vice president re-emerged in May 2019 after he announced his candidacy for president.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden once said he had "no empathy" for the plight of younger people.

title: Is Tina Turner 'Gravely Ill' With Stomach Cancer or Other Disease?
subtitle: The legendary singer revealed in her 2018 autobiography that she had coped with bouts of cancer, stroke, and kidney disease.
author: David Emery
