subtitle: A tweet about an online survey on the Fox News host's website misrepresented the nature of that poll.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Bill O'Reily hired "university grad students" to conduct a phone survey of 25,000 people about the presidential election.

title: Trump Just Removed His Name from His Hotels Due to Plummeting Business?
subtitle: Trump Hotels announced in September 2016 that their new hotels would be named "Scion," but the name "Trump" is not being removed from established hotels.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Trump hotels are being renamed to eliminate use of the name 'Trump.'

title: Ronald Reagan Beat Jimmy Carter in a Landslide Despite Trailing 6% in Polls?
subtitle: The claim that Reagan won the 1980 presidential election in a landslide despite trailing well behind Carter in late public opinion polls is cited as a reason to get out and vote for Donald Trump.
author: David Emery
statement: Ronald Reagan won the 1980 presidential election in a landslide despite trailing Jimmy Carter in public opinion polls two weeks earlier, so polls cannot be trusted to predict election results.

title: Do Mail-In Ballots Require Extra Postage?
subtitle: If you're submitting a ballot by mail, you might need additional postage (and the directions printed on the envelope might be incorrect).
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Mail-in ballots require additional stamps and will not be counted if affixed postage is insufficient.

title: Do Women's Brains Shrink During Pregnancy?
subtitle: Online images tout the sparsely researched claim that a woman's brain shrinks during pregnancy, but the science behind it is more complicated.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: During pregnancy, a woman's brain shrinks and takes up to six months to regain its previous size.

title: More U.S. Embassy Attacks Under Bush and Reagan than Obama?
subtitle: We investigate the claim that more U.S. embassy attacks, with more fatalities, occurred under George W. Bush and Ronald Reagan than during the Obama administration.
author: David Emery
statement: More attacks on U.S. embassies, with more people killed, occurred during the G.W. Bush and Reagan administrations than under Obama.

title: Donald Trump Accused of Rape and Human Trafficking
subtitle: In the wake of a controversy over lewd comments, someone stitched together claims about Donald Trump's alleged abuse of women.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump raped his former wife and a young woman, and his modeling agency was found to be trafficking young girls.

title: Does It Cost Taxpayers $200,000 per Hour for President Obama to Use Air Force One to Campaign for Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: Taxpayers pick up part of the tab when a President makes campaign trips on Air Force One, but with rare exceptions that's the only mode of air travel the President can use.
author: David Emery
statement: It costs American taxpayers roughly $200,000 an hour every time President Obama travels in Air Force One to campaign for Hillary Clinton.

title: Does Nigerian Girls' Science Fair Project Turn One Liter of Urine Into Six Hours of Electricity?
subtitle: A urine-powered generator built by a team of high school girls at Maker Faire Africa in 2012 is pretty slick, but the technology is not as game-changing as numerous online images have suggested.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A team of four Nigerian girls has created a generator that produces six hours of electricity using only a single liter of urine as fuel.

title: Did Joseph Stalin Say, 'It's Not the People Who Vote That Count …'?
subtitle: One version of a famous quote about those who count the votes determining the outcome of an election is attributed to Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin in his secretary's memoir.
author: David Emery
statement: Joseph Stalin said some version of "It's not the people who vote that count, it's the people who count the votes."

title: Marmite Cures Premature Ejaculation?
subtitle: New research suggests a connection between Vitamin B12 deficiencies and premature ejaculation, but no research paper has ever tested either B12's or Marmite's efficacy as a therapy for the condition.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: New research suggests that Marmite helps combat premature ejaculation.

title: WikiLeaks Confirms Hillary Clinton Sold Weapons to ISIS?
subtitle: As WikiLeaks released several batches of e-mails in October 2016,  partisans claimed they confirmed Hillary Clinton sold weapons to ISIS.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: E-mails released by WikiLeaks confirm Hillary Clinton sold weapons to ISIS.

title: Leaked E-mails Show John Podesta Discussed Alien Technology with Former NASA Astronaut
subtitle: A retired astronaut with some eccentric views did attempt to set up a meeting with Hillary Clinton's campaign chairman, but that's about as far as it got.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Wikileaks' dump of John Podesta's e-mails reveal conversations he had with a former NASA astronaut about the existence of aliens, alien technology, and space warfare.

title: George W. Bush White House 'Lost' 22 Million E-mails?
subtitle: Some 22 million official White House e-mails, the majority of which were sent and received via private, non-government servers, were reported as lost or missing during the George W. Bush administration.
author: David Emery
statement: The G.W. Bush administration "lost" 22 million official e-mails sent and received via private servers between the years 2003 and 2005.

title: Were Bees Added to the Endangered Species List?
subtitle: After seven species of yellow-faced bees were added to the endangered species list in October 2016, a rumor circulated that all bees had been classified as endangered.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bees have been classified as an endangered species.

title: Mike Pence: Gay People Aren't 'Able Bodied' Enough for Military Service
subtitle: Republican VP candidate Mike Pence headed the organization that published an article about gay men being unfit for military service, but he did not write the article himself.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Indiana Gov. Mike Pence said homosexuals are "not as a group able-bodied" and "known to carry extremely high rates of disease brought on because of the nature of their sexual practices."

title: Kristian Saucier vs. Hillary Clinton
subtitle: An exchange during the vice presidential debate led to renewed comparisons between Hillary Clinton and jailed Navy sailor Kristian Saucier.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Navy sailor Kristian Saucier was held to a different standard of prosecution for improper handling of classified information than Hillary Clinton.

title: Ramsey Orta Jailed for Filming Eric Garner's Death
subtitle: Ramsey Orta was sentenced to four years in prison in October 2016, but the charges were not specifically related to his having filmed Eric Garner's officer-involved death.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Ramsey Orta went to jail for filming the fatal encounter between Eric Garner and New York City police officers.

title: 40 Million Russians in Drills for Possible Nuclear Strike
subtitle: The drills were part of a disaster exercise, not an indication of an imminent nuclear war.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: 40 million Russians conducted drills for an imminent nuclear strike.

title: Muslim Woman Buys Soda with Food Stamps to Resell?
subtitle: A viral video depicts a man who followed a purportedly Muslim woman to her vehicle at night and accused her of using food stamps to buy soda to sell in her store.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A video depicts a Muslim woman fraudulently using food stamps to purchase soda to resell at her store.

title: Accused Cascade Mall Shooter Arcan Cetin Voted as a Non-Citizen?
subtitle: Accused Cascade Mall shooter Arcan Cetin reportedly was registered to vote and participated in three elections, despite being a green card holder and not a naturalized citizen.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Alleged Cascade Mall shooter Arcan Cetin voted in three elections despite not being a U.S. citizen.

title: Did Chelsea Clinton Say That Marijuana Is Killing People?
subtitle: Chelsea Clinton made factually questionable statements about marijuana during a September 2016 campaign rally, but she didn't outright claim pot itself kills.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: During a campaign rally, Chelsea Clinton stated that marijuana use can be fatal.

title: Did the U.S. Ignore the 'Racist' Murder of an Elderly White Woman?
subtitle: The brutal murder of an elderly white Georgia woman involving African-American suspects has not proved to be a racially motivated killing.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: No one is calling out the racist killing of a white woman by a "black gang."

title: Canned Pumpkin Isn't Actually Pumpkin?
subtitle: Just ahead of the fall holidays, a viral social media rumor suggested the pumpkin in pumpkin pie is secretly produced from other squash.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Most canned pumpkin isn't actually pumpkin, but a mixture of other squashes (including butternut).

title: The Origins of Policing in the United States
subtitle: Memes claim that modern law enforcement evolved out of slave patrols.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The modern policing system in the United States originated from patrols intended to corral escaped slaves.

title: Does Watching Horror Movies Reduce Risk of Obesity?
subtitle: A medical study purportedly showed that watching a scary movie can burn a significant number of calories and even reduce the risk of obesity by increasing the viewer's heart rate.
author: David Emery
statement: Watching horror movies increases calorie consumption and reduces the risk of obesity.

title: Obama and Trump Use Umbrellas
subtitle: Two photographs from September 2016 appear to show marked differences in Donald Trump's and Barack Obama's umbrella etiquette.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Donald Trump using an umbrella to keep only himself dry, while another image shows President Obama giving his umbrella to Michelle Obama to keep her dry.

title: Do Police Kill More White People Than Black People?
subtitle: More white people are killed in police shootings than Black Americans, but overall white people are statistically less likely to be killed by police than Black people.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Police shootings kill more white Americans than Black Americans.

title: Massachusetts Passes Law Allowing Black Men to Run from Police Due to Racial Profiling?
subtitle: The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court cited "a pattern of racial profiling of blacks in the city of Boston," but they didn't make it broadly legal to flee from police.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Massachusetts judge passed a law making it legal for black men to run from police because they are at risk of being racially profiled.

title: Fatima Noor Appointed to Homeland Security
subtitle: Fatima Noor, a foreign-born Muslim woman, worked for the DHS but wasn't appointed by President Obama to be Assistant Director for U.S. Citizenship and Immigration.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama appointed Fatima Noor as the head of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services in the Department of Homeland Security.

title: Small Canadian Town Will Give You a Job and Land to Relocate
subtitle: A small business in Canada is offering a job and land to those willing to relocate to Nova Scotia, but only to those who are legally allowed to work in Canada.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A small business in Canada is offering jobs and free land to Americans looking to relocate in the event of a Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton presidency.

title: Hillary Clinton Calls for Americans to Respect and Empathize with ISIS?
subtitle: A 10-second clip from a 2014 speech by Hillary Clinton has been misrepresented as an instance of her calling on Americans to "respect and empathize with" terrorists.
author: David Emery
statement: Hillary Clinton made a speech calling for Americans to respect and empathize with ISIS.

title: Does Luxottica Own 80% of the Eyeglass Industry?
subtitle: It's true that Luxottica controls a large chunk of the eyewear industry, but possibly not nearly as much as 80 percent.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Luxottica controls 80 percent of eyewear brands, several major optometry chains, and the second-largest vision care insurer.

title: Are Gummi Bears Made with Car Wax?
subtitle: Carnauba wax is used to add an attractive sheen to everything from cars to candy -- including fruit-flavored snacks such as Gummi Bears.
author: Stephanie Larsen
statement: The popular Gummi Bears (and similar fruit-flavored candies) are made with carnauba wax, the same ingredient that is found in car polish.

title: Dolly Parton 'Trashes' Hillary Clinton?
subtitle: A misleading article reported that Dolly Parton "trashed" Hillary Clinton by calling her "crazy," when she actually said that both presidential candidates were nuts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Dolly Parton publicly criticized Hillary Clinton and endorsed Donald Trump.

title: All Living Ex-Presidents Warn Against Donald Trump
subtitle: An image reporting that all living ex-presidents have warned Americans to not vote for Donald Trump is not quite accurate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: All living former Presidents of the United States have urged Americans to not vote for Donald Trump.

title: Massive Stone Age Tunnel Stretches from Scotland to Turkey
subtitle: Mysterious underground passages known as "Erdstall" have been found throughout Europe, but there's no evidence of a continuous tunnel running from Scotland to Turkey.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Stone Age tunnels have been found that stretch thousands of miles all the way from Scotland to Turkey.

title: Did a WTC Leaseholder Buy Terrorism Insurance Just Before 9/11?
subtitle: A longstanding urban legend holds that World Trade Center leaseholder Larry Silverstein "fortuitously" took out terrorism insurance just months before the 9/11 attacks.
author: David Emery
statement: World Trade Center leaseholder Larry Silverstein bought terrorism insurance two months before 9/11, then collected double its value on the grounds that there were two attacks.

title: 'Doonesbury' Predicted Trump's 2016 Presidential Run?
subtitle: A 'Doonesbury' comic strip from 1999 didn't 'predict' Trump's 2016 presidential run; it mocked his possible 2000 campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Doonesbury comic from 1999 predicted Donald Trump's presidential run in 2016.

title: Michigan Farmers Forced to Destroy Edible Cherries to Prop Up Imports?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post about surplus U.S. cherry crops destroyed to "make room for imports" appeals to locavores but contains some inaccuracies.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Michigan farmer was forced to destroy 40,000 edible cherries to make way for cherries imported from outside the U.S.

title: Canada Legalizes Heroin?
subtitle: Although Canada has introduced new provisions for doctors to legally prescribe heroin to some addicts, they haven't legalized that narcotic for general use.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Canada has legalized heroin for general use.

title: Did Donald Trump Meet with an Anti-Gay Hate Group Shunned by Other Candidates?
subtitle: Donald Trump did attend the 2016 Values Voter summit, but the claim that the event was "shunned" by preceding GOP candidates is unfounded.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump attended a hate group gathering "snubbed" by former GOP candidates Mitt Romney and John McCain.

title: Girls' Life vs. Boys' Life Magazine Covers
subtitle: A side-by-side comparison of a magazine for girls and another for boys appears to reveal a major divide in the way the media socialize each, but there was more to the story.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The September 2016 issue of "Boys' Life" explores future careers and personal development, but the same month's issue of "Girls' Life" features articles about how to be pretty, showing a disparity in the way the media treats boys and girls.

title: Did Trump Brag He Had the 'Tallest Building in Manhattan' After the 9/11 Attacks?
subtitle: Donald Trump spoke of having the tallest building in downtown Manhattan after the 9/11 attacks, but whether he was "bragging" is in the eye of the beholder.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump bragged that he had tallest building in downtown Manhattan after the 9/11 attacks destroyed the World Trade Center.

title: Will Alaska Pay You $2,000 Not to Leave the State?
subtitle: A partially accurate meme claimed that Alaska will pay you more than $2,000 not to move away, provided you live there 190 days a year and aren't a felon.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: All Alaska residents who live in the state 190 days a year and who are not felons receive $2,000 a year.

title: NFL Fining Players for Wearing 9/11 Memorial Cleats?
subtitle: Rumor held that the NFL fined players for violating league uniform rules by wearing 9/11 memorial cleats during football games played on 11 September 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The NFL fined players for violating league uniform rules by wearing 9/11 memorial cleats during football games played on 11 September 2016.

title: Florida Governor's Wife Has Zika Mosquito Spray Business
subtitle: Ann Scott doesn't own a mosquito spraying business, but she does have a large financial stake in a Gulf Coast company.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Ann Scott, the wife of Florida's governor, owns a Zika mosquito spraying business.

title: Ivanka Trump's 'Lap Dance' with Donald
subtitle: A photograph showing Ivanka Trump seemingly sitting on her famous father's lap documents less than is salaciously claimed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows Ivanka Trump grinding on the lap of her father, Donald Trump.

title: Kratom Banned by the DEA?
subtitle: The DEA announced the popular herbal analgesic kratom would be reclassified as a Schedule I drug, despite public outcry and scant evidence of danger.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The U.S. Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA)  has classified kratom as a Schedule I substance as of  30 September 2016.

title: 'Purple Paint' Trespass Warning
subtitle: Information about 'purple paint' trespass warning laws in some states is often shared under misleading titles.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Purple paint on a fence post indicates that you are in danger and should leave the area immediately.

title: Did a Muslim Woman Demand Men Leave a Salon So She Could Get Her Hair Styled?
subtitle: A Norwegian hairdresser is facing legal punishment for discriminating against a hijab-wearing woman.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A Muslim woman entered a co-ed hair salon and demanded all the men there leave so she could take off her veil to get her hair done.

title: Half-Eaten Shark Washes Up in Daytona
subtitle: Forced perspective made a photograph of a "half-eaten shark" appear more mysterious than it was in real life.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts a huge, inexplicably half-eaten shark found on a Florida beach.

title: How to Spot a Two-Way Mirror
subtitle: Is looking for a gap between an object and its reflection a good way to distinguish two-way mirrors from ordinary mirrors?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Looking for a gap between an object and its reflection is a way to distinguish two-way mirrors from ordinary mirrors.

title: ATF Reclassifies Wetted Nitrocellulose as High Explosive
subtitle: Pending industry input, the government reclassification of ammo component wetted nitrocellulose from "nonexplosive" to "high explosive" has been rescinded.
author: David Emery
statement: The Bureau of Alcohol, Firearms and Tobacco (ATF) has reclassified wet nitrocellulose as a high explosive.

title: Is This a Picture of Congressmembers Sitting During the Pledge of Allegiance?
subtitle: "Y'all are mad at an athlete? This is your government!"
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows members of the U.S. government sitting during the recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance.

title: Steve Bannon's Vulgar Quote About Birth Control?
subtitle: An article asserting that injectable birth control makes women unattractive was published on Breitbart, but it wasn't written by Trump campaign chief Steve Bannon.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's campaign chief Steve Bannon said that injectable birth control makes women fat and prevents them from getting "man meat" injections.

title: Clinton Foundation Scores Higher as a Charity than the Red Cross?
subtitle: The Red Cross was ranked as an "A-" to the Clinton Foundation's "A" by CharityWatch, but the larger Charity Navigator didn't rate the latter organization until recently.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Clinton Foundation rates higher than the Red Cross in charity rankings.

title: What Rosie O'Donnell Really Said She'd Like to Do with Her Period Blood
subtitle: Comedian Rosie O'Donnell stands accused of saying 'I'd like to take my period blood and smear it all over Christians' faces' -- but it's not an accurate quote.
author: David Emery
statement: During a radio interview, Rosie O'Donnell said, "I'd like to take my period blood and smear it all over Christians' [or pro-life people's] faces."

title: California Government Pays for Criminals to Take Vacations?
subtitle: A pilot program intended to reduce violence in the city of Richmond, California, gives young people stipends if they keep their commitments to the operation.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The state of California pays criminals not to kill and sends them on free vacations.

title: Was a Woman Sentenced to Five Years for Sending Her Son to a Better School?
subtitle: Images contrasting the sentencings of white swimmers with that of homeless mother Tanya McDowell depicted perceived inequality in the criminal-justice system.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Collegiate athletes were sentenced lightly for serious crimes while a homeless mother was sentenced to five years in prison for enrolling her son in the wrong Connecticut school.

title: Bill and Melinda Gates Are Giving Away Free College Textbooks?
subtitle: An image suggesting that Bill and Melinda Gates are giving away free college textbooks is somewhat misleading.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bill and Melinda Gates started a web site to give away free college textbooks.

title: Hillary Clinton Listed As Threat in Army Training Slide
subtitle: A photograph showing an Army training slide labeling Hillary Clinton as an insider threat is real but was used only by a single unit and not approved by leadership.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A United States Army training slide labeled Hillary Clinton as an insider threat.

title: Did J.K. Rowling Drop Off Forbes Billionaires List Due to Charitable Donations?
subtitle: A popular Internet meme says 'Harry Potter' author J.K. Rowling dropped off the Forbes billionaires list because she gave so much money to charity.
author: David Emery
statement: Author J.K. Rowling was the first person to fall off of the Forbes billionaires list due to donating so much money to charity.

title: Donald Trump Gave His 2nd Grade Music Teacher a Black Eye
subtitle: Donald Trump's 'The Art of the Deal' says that he punched out his music teacher because he 'didn't think he knew anything about music.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump wrote in 'The Art of the Deal' that he punched out his second grade music teacher.

title: Old Reginald Denny Beating Picture Circulates Urging Drivers to Run Over Protesters
subtitle: The post uses a 24-year-old picture from the Los Angeles riots to deride modern-day Black Lives Matter protests.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: An old image of truck driver Reginald Denny advocates that drivers not stop for road-blocking protesters.

title: Should You Save Baby Teeth for Stem Cells?
subtitle: We look into the recommendation that parents preserve their kids' baby teeth so stem cells can be harvested from them for future use in treating disease.
author: David Emery
statement: Stem cells can be harvested from baby teeth, so it's a good idea to preserve them in private stem cell banks for future use in medical treatments.

title: Video: Black Protesters Targeted Whites in Milwaukee?
subtitle: The origins of an edited video claiming to show black protesters hunting down and beating whites in Milwaukee are murky.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A video captures African-American protesters targeting white people for mob violence during unrest in Milwaukee over the weekend of 13 August 2016.

title: Katrina Pierson Arrested for Shoplifting, Illegally Collected Unemployment?
subtitle: Donald Trump campaign spokeswoman Katrina Pierson has been described as a "shoplifting welfare cheat."  Is that an accurate characterization?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump campaign spokeswoman Katrina Pierson was arrested for shoplifting and continued to collect unemployment benefits while working.

title: Has Crossbreeding Humans with Animals Been Approved in the United States?
subtitle: A misleadingly titled article asserted that the U.S. had approved plans to mix animal and human DNA.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The United States has approved plans to crossbreed animals and humans.

title: Bob Beckel Called for WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange to Be Assassinated
subtitle: Pundit Bob Beckel called for the assassination of Julian Assange in 2010, but not as a Hillary Clinton campaign strategist.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton strategist Bob Beckel called for the assassination of Wikileaks founder Julian Assange.

title: Bernie Sanders: 'I'd Never Tell My Supporters How to Vote'
subtitle: After Hillary Clinton won the 2016 Democratic primary, rumors circulated that Bernie Sanders informed his supporters that if he ever told them whom to vote for, they shouldn't listen to them.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders informed his supporters that he'd never tell them whom to vote for, and that if he did they shouldn't listen to him.

title: Is it Impossible to Cancel Recurring Donations to the Trump Campaign?
subtitle: A CNN reporter tweeted out a former Donald Trump supporter's claim that it was impossible to cancel recurring donations to the campaign once initiated, but it wasn't clear that was always the case.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: It is impossible to cancel recurring donations to the Donald Trump presidential campaign.

title: Vaping Causes 'Popcorn Lung'?
subtitle: Disreputable viral web sites matched an unrelated photograph with claims that a study had linked e-cigarettes with popcorn lung.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A study proved e-cigarette use (or vaping) leads to an incurable condition known as "popcorn lung."

title: Did Trump Say 'Laziness Is a Trait in Blacks; No Black President Again Any Time Soon'?
subtitle: A meme created the impression that Donald Trump claimed that there wouldn't be a black president again any time soon because 'laziness is a trait in blacks.'
author: David Emery
statement: Donald Trump said, "Laziness is a trait in blacks ... I believe that. No black person will be president again any time soon."

title: Photograph of Hillary Clinton Slipping on Stairs Circulated as Proof of Poor Health
subtitle: Several right-wing web sites circulated a months-old photograph of Hillary Clinton slipping on some stairs as the 'latest evidence' that she is in poor health.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows that Hillary Clinton needs help walking up stairs is the 'latest evidence' that she is in poor health.

title: Cicret Bracelet
subtitle: Wearable technology branded the 'Cicret bracelet' claims to project your smartphone directly onto your forearm.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Cicret bracelet and app can project your smartphone onto your arm.

title: Obama Cuts Military Pay 3rd Year in a Row?
subtitle: An online article claims President Obama has used a loophole in federal statutes to cut military pay for three years in a row. That's half-true.
author: David Emery
statement: President Obama has used a loophole in federal statutes to cut military pay three years in a row.

title: Did Police Give Instructions for Citizens Rescuing Dogs from Hot Cars?
subtitle: A popular message incorrectly advised that citizens could avoid criminal charges if they followed specific steps in rescuing dogs (or babies) from hot cars.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Police have officially approved a series of steps you can take to avoid criminal charges when breaking a window to save a dog or baby from a hot car.

title: Google Result for 'Trap' Shows Liberal Agenda?
subtitle: Searching Google for the word "trap" will result in an example about demonstrators and police, but the sentence wasn't written by the search engine giant.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Google's definition for the word "trap" includes an example sentence about demonstrators and police.

title: Sarah Silverman: Killing Jesus
subtitle: After Sarah Silverman appeared at the July 2016 Democratic National Convention, images popped up claiming she made offensive statements about Jews killing Jesus.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Sarah Silverman said "I hope the Jews did kill Jesus, I'd do it again in a second!"

title: Does the Satanic Temple Want to Establish After School Satan Clubs?
subtitle: A 'religious' organization called the Satanic Temple seeks to establish After School Satan Clubs in public schools. Is it an effort to teach Satan worship to kids?
author: David Emery
statement: A group called the Satanic Temple wants to establish After School Satan Clubs in public schools to introduce children to the "religion of darkness."

title: Tim Kaine Made DNC Vice Presidential Deal with Hillary Clinton in 2011
subtitle: While a timeline about Tim Kaine's former position as DNC chair is roughly accurate, political reporting from that time suggested a more complicated chain of events.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton's running mate Tim Kaine stepped aside as DNC chair in 2011 to allow Clinton supporter Debbie Wasserman Schultz to take the job spot in exchange for a slot on the 2016 ticket; in October 2016,

title: Barack Obama: 'Hillary Clinton Isn't Qualified to Be President'
subtitle: A 2008 Obama campaign ad stated that Hillary Clinton 'will say anything and do nothing,'  but Obama didn't say that she was not qualified to be president.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Barack Obama said that Hillary Clinton would "say anything and do nothing" and that she was not qualified for the presidency in 2008.

title: DNC Walkout Leads to Hundreds of Empty Seats?
subtitle: After Sanders delegates participated in a DNC Walkout, claims about empty seats became a point of debate on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: After the 26 July 2016 roll call vote at the Democratic National Convention, hundreds of empty seats appeared to have been vacated by a planned protest.

title: So You Think You Know the Real Donald Trump?
subtitle: A list tallies some of the good deeds credited to Donald Trump.  How accurate is it?
author: Dan Evon
statement: A list tallies some of the good deeds accomplished by  Donald Trump.

title: Ted Cruz Plots on Air Force One
subtitle: Ted Cruz was photographed leaving Air Force One with Democratic plotters who supposedly convinced him not to endorse Donald Trump at the RNC.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ted Cruz met with President Obama, Hillary Clinton, and Valerie Jarrett on Air Force One a few days before the RNC, and they convinced him not to endorse Donald Trump.

title: Pokemon Go Caused a Fatal Crash in Knoxville?
subtitle: A man was tragically killed in a wrong way crash near Knoxville, but police say there's no indication Pokemon Go was involved in the accident.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Knoxville man was killed in a fiery collision caused by a wrong-way driver playing Pokemon Go.

title: Massachusetts Just Banned the Sale of All Semi-Automatic Rifles
subtitle: Massachusetts didn't announce a new law banning the sale of semi-automatic rifles, but rather enforcement of an existing law on assault weapons.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In July 2016, Massachusetts implemented a new ban on the sale of all semi-automatic rifles.

title: Diversity Among Democratic and Republic Interns
subtitle: An image comparing the diversity (or lack thereof) of Republican and Democratic interns is somewhat misleading.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An image shows that Democratic interns are much more diverse as a group than Republican interns.

title: Officer Hospitalized After Being Served Sandwich Containing Glass Shards
subtitle: Police do not believe that the restaurant intentionally tried to harm him.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A police officer was intentionally served a sandwich containing glass shards at a restaurant in Ohio.

title: Al Sharpton's 1992 Speech Urged Blacks to Kill Police
subtitle: A video of a speech Al Sharpton delivered in 1992 at Kean College is real but is frequently shared out of context or with misleading information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: In 1992 Al Sharpton delivered a speech in which he exhorted blacks to kill police.

title: Catching Sexually Transmitted Diseases While Tanning
subtitle: Despite a proliferation of scary articles, the likelihood of getting herpes from a tanning bed is very small.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Improperly cleaned tanning beds are vectors for sexually transmitted diseases such as herpes.

title: You Had a Hunch the News System Was Rigged?
subtitle: A list documenting purported familial ties between news media personnel and the Obama administration was often shared as evidence that the news system was rigged in the President's favor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A list shows documents that several prominent news media executives had ties to the Obama administration.

title: Open Letter to Donald Trump from Wharton School
subtitle: An open letter to Donald Trump stating that he does not represent the Wharton School does not reflect the official viewpoint of that school.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Wharton School wrote an open letter to Donald Trump explaining that the Republican Presidential candidate does not represent his former school.

title: Brandenn Bremmer Suicide
subtitle: A viral image about late prodigy Brandenn Bremmer got some facts right but also included mere speculation.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Young prodigy Brandenn Bremmer achieved a number of successes before taking his own life at age14 so that he could donate his organs to others.

title: Bernie Sanders, FDR, and Contested Conventions
subtitle: After Bernie Sanders endorsed Hillary Clinton, rumors circulated holding that the endorsement was coerced and that FDR won the nomination under similar circumstances in 1932.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders was forced to endorse Hillary Clinton under DNC rules, but can go on to win a contested convention like FDR (who also endorsed his opponent before winning).

title: Have 3D Printed Rhino Horns Been Developed to Stop Poaching?
subtitle: Several biotechnology firms have developed undetectably fake rhino horns as an anti-poaching measure, but wildlife experts aren't thrilled about the innovation.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A biotech company has developed a 3D synthetic rhino horn that will eventually undercut the market for poached horns.

title: Pandora Endorses Black Lives Matter?
subtitle: The streaming music service Pandora caused controversy by posting a message using the hashtag #BlackLivesMatter on social media.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The streaming music service Pandora endorsed the Black Lives Matter movement while ignoring the deaths of Dallas police officers.

title: Was Officer Nakia Jones Fired After Posting a Viral Police Brutality Video?
subtitle: Nakia Jones said the Warrensville Heights Police Department fired her after she made a video in July 2016 following the shooting death of Alton Sterling in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Police officer Nakia Jones was fired after expressing her thoughts about police brutality in a viral Facebook live video.

title: Alton Sterling: Longtime Criminal and Gang Member?
subtitle: Articles published in the aftermath of Alton Sterling's shooting death reported that he was a gang member and had a lengthy arrest record.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Alton Sterling was a member of the Bloods gang and had a lengthy criminal record.

title: Swedish Police Hand Out 'Don't Touch Me' Bracelets to Stop Refugee Rapists?
subtitle: Police in Sweden have introduced sexual assault awareness bracelets to distribute to young people, but not as an effort to stop "refugee rape."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Swedish police have introduced anti-sexual assault bracelets due to an increase in "refugee rape."

title: Hillary Clinton Demanded This Photo Be Removed
subtitle: A long-circulating photograph of a haggard-looking Hillary Clinton is an altered version of the original, and Clinton has not demanded it be erased from the Internet.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph depicts an unkempt Hillary Clinton, and she has demanded that it be scrubbed from the internet.

title: Hillary Clinton Hijab Campaign Ad
subtitle: A one-second segment of an October 2015 video tweeted by Hillary Clinton was screencapped to suggest the candidate had donned a hijab for a new campaign ad.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton donned a hijab for a new campaign ad.

title: 'Large-Scale Motion' Detected at San Andreas Fault
subtitle: A story about motion around a major fault in California was not as dire as headlines made it seem.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: The San Andreas fault is on the move, signaling that a massive earthquake might be imminent.

title: Causes of Death in the United States
subtitle: A list of statistics showing the leading causes of death in the United States through June 2016 includes some questionable aspects.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A list of statistics shows the leading causes of death in the United States through the first half of 2016.

title: Does Octopus DNA Come from Space?
subtitle: Rsearchers didn't discover that octopus DNA is "alien," or that it originated anywhere but on Earth, although a few have suggested the possibilty.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Researchers have discovered that octopus genomes contain alien DNA.

title: Is Orlando Shooting Hero Imran Yousuf a Muslim?
subtitle: A popular meme incorrectly states that former U.S. Marine and heroic Pulse bouncer Imran Yousuf is Muslim.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Former Marine Imran Yousuf, a Muslim, is credited with saving 70 people during the June 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting.

title: Was the Vietnam Memorial Vandalized with Graffiti?
subtitle: A replica Vietnam Wall in Los Angeles was defaced by vandals in 2016, but the larger monument in Washington, D.C., was not.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Vietnam Veterans Memorial was defaced with graffiti in 2016.

title: Laila Alawa and the Department of Homeland Security
subtitle: Inaccurate reporting was common on the subject of Laila Alawa's appointment to  a DHS advisory subcommittee on violent extremism.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: After the Orlando shooting, President Obama recruited Laila Alawa to serve on an anti-violent extremism Department of Homeland Security task force.

title: Uniformed Veteran Kicked Out of Child's School
subtitle: A misleading social media page claimed a uniformed veteran was kicked out of his daughter's school because his attire was offensive.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A military veteran picking his child up from school was ejected lest other students find his uniform offensive.

title: Stanford Study Proves Election Fraud through Exit Poll Discrepancies
subtitle: Two researchers released a paper (not a study) examining whether primary election fraud that favored Hillary Clinton had occurred.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A 2016 Stanford study revealed widespread primary election fraud in multiple states favoring Hillary Clinton.

title: Orlando Shooter Was a Democrat?
subtitle: In 2006 Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen registered to vote as a Democrat, but his recent political leanings are unknown.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Orlando nightclub shooter Omar Mateen was a Democrat.

title: Trump Tweets That He 'Appreciates the Congrats' on Being Right About Terrorism
subtitle: Donald Trump tweeted that he appreciated "the congrats for being right on radical Islamic terrorism" after a mass shooting in Orlando, but that wasn't his full message.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump tweeted that he appreciated "the congrats for being right on radical Islamic terrorism" after a mass shooting in Orlando.

title: Did Canada Legalize Bestiality?
subtitle: The Supreme Court of Canada ruled that the country's current legal definition of bestiality only bans penetrative sexual acts with animals, but it didn't legalize any other similar activities.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Canada has legalized oral sex with non-human animals.

title: Oklahoma Police Get New Device for Civil Forfeitures
subtitle: While Oklahoma police did get a new device to make civil forfeitures, this device cannot empty anybody's bank account.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Oklahoma Highway Patrol is using a device called an "ERAD" to seize money from people's bank accounts.

title: Victoria Woodhull Was the First Female Presidential Candidate, Not Hillary Clinton
subtitle: Social media debate erupted over whether Hillary Clinton was the first female presumptive nominee for President, or if that honor went to Victoria Woodhull.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Victoria Woodhull, not Hillary Clinton, was the first female presidential nominee.

title: Hillary Clinton's $12,000 Armani Jacket
subtitle: Outrage over an expensive Armani jacket worn by Hillary Clinton during her New York primary acceptance speech  included some inaccurate details.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Hillary Clinton purchased a $12,000 Giorgio Armani jacket to deliver a speech about income inequality.

title: Sotomayor Speech From 2001 Recirculates After Trump Comments on Judge's Mexican Heritage
subtitle: Several outlets attempted to defend Donald Trump's comments about a "Mexican" judge by invoking a 2001 speech given by Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sotomayor said that "ethnicity and sex" of a judge may and will make a difference in judging.

title: 1970 U.S. Quarter Struck on 1941 Canadian Quarter
subtitle: An eBay listing for a quarter that was reportedly minted on the back of a 1941 Canadian coin appears to be real, but the money probably won't turn up in anybody's couch cushions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A handful of 1970s quarters are worth a fortune, as they were minted on the back of a 1941 Canadian coin.

title: Home Depot Co-Founder Endorses Donald Trump
subtitle: Bernie Marcus has contributed to Trump's campaigns, but he is no longer the CEO or chairman of the home improvement chain.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Home Depot co-founder and CEO Bernie Marcus endorsed Donald Trump for president.

title: Chicks Hatched Without Eggshells
subtitle: A video purportedly shows a group of high school students hatching a chick that developed outside an eggshell for the first time in history.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of high school students hatching a chick that developed outside an eggshell for the first time in history.

title: California to Jail Climate Change Skeptics
subtitle: A California legislative bill didn't seek to jail climate change deniers; it sought to allow civil claims against businesses and organizations who spread misinformation about climate change.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: California legislators have made it illegal for anyone to deny climate change, under threat of jail time.

title: Arabic on Canadian Police Cars
subtitle: Some Canadian police cars have Arabic writing on their sides, but it's been there since 2009 and has nothing to do with refugees.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: In 2016, police in Canada began adding Arabic writing to the outside of police cruisers.

title: James Dobson Urges Parents to 'Protect' Children from 'Tyrant Obama' and 'Transgender Bathrooms'
subtitle: The evangelical Christian author wrote an article encouraging parents to keep their children safe from transgender individuals using the "wrong" bathroom.
author: Dan Evon
statement: James Dobson said that parents should shoot transgender individuals if they use the "wrong" restroom.

title: Do Male Penguins Make 'Pebble Proposals' to Their Mates?
subtitle: A social media factoid about penguin courtship and the "perfect pebble" does not quite reflect the birds' actual mating habits.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A male penguin searches an entire beach for the "perfect pebble" to lay at the feet of his chosen female penguin.

title: Sanders-Trump Debate?
subtitle: Conflicting reports circulated about whether presumptive GOP nominee Donald Trump agreed to debate Democrat candidate Bernie Sanders before the California primary.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: After Hillary Clinton refused to participate in a final debate, GOP candidate Donald Trump agreed to debate Democrat challenger Bernie Sanders.

title: L'Oreal Beagle Testing
subtitle: A viral Facebook image purportedly depicts a beagle blinded by L'Oreal cosmetics testing, but the image was previously linked with a separate and unrelated controversy in Brazil.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Image depicts a beagle blinded in animal testing carried out by L'Oreal cosmetics.

title: QuikTrip Safe Place
subtitle: A viral Facebook post regarding QuikTrip's partnership with the Safe Place initiative contains some dangerously inaccurate information about the scope of services provided.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: QuikTrip's Safe Place is equipped to provide a safe room and assistance to a variety of victims of violence or persons otherwise in danger.

title: Target Sues 'Hero' for Saving Stabbing Victim
subtitle: Target did sue Michael Turner, a man who saved a girl from being stabbed in one of their stores, but the lawsuit was about more than that.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Target sued a man for saving a girl from being stabbed in one of their stores.

title: Obama Issues 'Kill Order' for Bald Eagles
subtitle: The Obama administration has proposed revising power guidelines that may affect bald eagles but hasn't issued a "kill order" for thousands of the birds.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Obama administration has proposed revising power guidelines that could affect eagles, but the President hasn't issued a "kill order" allowing the slaughter of thousands of bald eagles per year.

title: Sanders vs. Clinton: Delegate Count
subtitle: A popular meme detailing the actual delegate count between Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton in May 2016 is mostly accurate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders trailed Hillary Clinton by only 271 delegates in May 2016, despite media inclusion of superdelegates in their respective totals.

title: Kellogg's to Add Peanut Flour to Products
subtitle: Recent changes to some Kellogg's products have raised concerns about potential allergic reactions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kellogg's is adding traces of peanut flour to its products.

title: Clinton Paid 'Hard Drive Destruction' Company
subtitle: Hillary Clinton's campaign made payments to data destruction companies, but no evidence links those services to her controversial use of a private e-mail server.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hillary Clinton's campaign made several payments to a company that destroys sensitive data due to an ongoing investigation into her use of e-mail while she was secretary of state.

title: Newt Gingrich Wrote an Essay Called 'Understanding Donald Trump'
subtitle: An essay written by Newt Gingrich in January 2016 was altered before it recirculated in April 2016.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Newt Gingrich wrote an essay entitled "Understanding Donald Trump."

title: Target Stock Plummets After One Million People Boycott Stores?
subtitle: Several web sites connected an exaggerated dip in Target's stock price to a recent boycott over the store's transgender bathroom policy.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Target's stock price has plummeted due to a boycott over the store's transgender restroom policy.

title: Athletes Will Not Be Disqualified for Olympic Rings Tattoos
subtitle: After a Paralympic swimmer was disqualified from a race for violating an advertising rule, a rumor circulated that all athletes will be disqualified for having Olympics-themed tattoos.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Athletes will be disqualified from Paralympic or Olympic events if they sport Olympics rings tattoos.

title: Hepatitis C Treatment Highlights Disparity in Worldwide Drug Prices
subtitle: A meme suggests that a course of treatment costing $900 in India carried a far heftier price tag in the United States.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A treatment for a serious disease that costs $900 in India is sold for $84,000 in the United States because of corporate greed.

title: Lesbian Kicked out of North Carolina Bathroom?
subtitle: A viral video of a young woman purportedly getting removed from a women's bathroom for not appearing feminine enough was not related to HB2.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A lesbian was removed from a women's bathroom by police in North Carolina because she wasn't feminine enough.

title: Where the Mississippi River Meets the Gulf of Mexico
subtitle: "Who else can let WATER meet and touch but NEVER mix together?"
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograh showing a body of water with two distinct colors is a permanent location where the Mississippi River meets the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Airport Worker Destroys Jet After Getting Fired
subtitle: A video of an excavator destroying a plane was circulated along with the claim that the act was carried out by a disgruntled employee.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows an airport worker destroying a plane after they were fired.

title: Landmarks Went Purple in Honor of Prince?
subtitle: Several landmarks went purple after Prince died, but not all of the images circulating are authentic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Landmarks all over the world were bathed in purple light to honor Prince after his death in April 2016.

title: Do 643,000 Bankruptcies Occur in the U.S. Every Year Due to Medical Bills?
subtitle: A popular meme holds that 643,000 Americans go bankrupt every year over medical bills, but the underlying math is elusive.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: 643,000 Americans declare bankruptcy over medical bills every year.

title: Target Transgender Bathroom Policy
subtitle: A social media controversy erupted when Target announced a chain-wide policy inviting transgender customers to use the bathroom that matched their gender identity.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Target caved to pressure from President Obama and LGBT groups and instituted a store-wide policy allowing transgender employees and shoppers to use the bathroom that matched their gender identity.

title: NC Bathroom Bill Opposition Leader a Sex Offender?
subtitle: A number of memes somewhat misleadingly reported that the "leader" of opposition to a controversial bathroom bill in North Carolina was a registered sex offender.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The man leading opposition to a controversial "bathroom bill" in North Carolina is a registered sex offender.

title: Were Car Headrests Designed as Emergency Escape Tools?
subtitle: Car headrests were designed for resting heads.  Any other use is incidental to their intended purpose.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Car headrests were deliberately designed to be removed so that they can be used to smash windows during emergencies.

title: Cocktails Came Out of Prohibition?
subtitle: A long-running claim that cocktails were an entirely American invention appears to be something of a myth.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Cocktails are a wholly American invention, popularized by Prohibition.

title: Is This the Space Shuttle Leaving Earth's Atmosphere?
subtitle: A photograph of the Space Shuttle Endeavour blasting off from Earth is real, but it has been subjected to photographic effects.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph taken from the International Space Station shows a Space Shuttle leaving Earth.

title: Tiger with Down Syndrome?
subtitle: While photographs showing a white tiger with unusual facial features are real, the animal was never diagnosed with Down syndrome.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Photographs show a white tiger with Down syndrome.

title: 'Abortionist' Strangled Baby Born Alive
subtitle: A decades-old story of a doctor purportedly strangling a live infant after complications during a saline abortion was misleadingly shared across social media as news in April 2016.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An "abortionist" strangled an infant following a failed saline abortion, while other clinicians failed to intervene.

title: Bernie Sanders Won Nevada?
subtitle: According to social media rumors, Bernie Sanders claimed a win in Nevada in a surprise post-caucus upset, but the reality was far more complex and less definitive.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A month after Hillary Clinton was declared the winner of Nevada's caucuses, Bernie Sanders retroactively collected more delegates to win the state.

title: Prescott College Mandatory 'Immigrant Fee'
subtitle: The student-led Freedom Education Fund imposed a $30 fee to fund a yearly scholarship for one undocumented undergraduate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Arizona's Prescott College is forcing students to pay a $30 fee for an undocumented immigrant scholarship fund.

title: Did Hillary Clinton Suppress Haiti's Minimum Wage?
subtitle: Rumors that Hillary Clinton (and the Clinton Foundation) used Haiti exclusively for personal gain are a mixed bag at best.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: As Secretary of State, Hillary Clinton artificially depressed Haiti's minimum wage; that action was part of a larger plan by the Clinton Foundation to profit from the country.

title: Drug Law Lobbying by Corrections Corporation of America
subtitle: The quote used by a popular meme about cannabis legalization and for-profit prisons is accurate, but its context is not.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Corrections Corporation of America (CCA) said that cannabis legalization would harm their profits, and they spend $1 million per year fighting changes to marijuana laws.

title: John Kasich Would Abolish Teachers' Lounges
subtitle: Republican presidential candidate John Kasich said that he would abolish teachers' lounges, but he wasn't really speaking literally.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Republican presidential candidate John Kasich said that he would abolish teachers' lounges.

title: Donald Trump Supports 'Some Form of Punishment' for Abortions
subtitle: Donald Trump's remarks about women facing "some form of punishment" for abortion were made in a context that remains unclear.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump said there should be "some form of punishment" for women who have abortions.

title: Bernie Sanders Flies Coach?
subtitle: Bernie Sanders famously flew coach through much of his campaign, but that may have changed after he was placed under Secret Service protection and the primary season got busier.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bernie Sanders flies coach while traveling for his presidential campaign.

title: Stephanie Cegielski Was Not Donald Trump's 'Top Strategist'
subtitle: Stephanie Cegielski, a former spokeswoman for the "Make America Great Again" super PAC, wrote an open letter to Donald Trump supporters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Stephanie Cegielski, Donald Trump's top strategist, wrote an open letter to the Republican candidate's supporters.

title: American Teen Survives Three Terrorist Attacks
subtitle: A 19-year-old who was hit by shrapnel in Brussels was also uncomfortably close to two other terrorist attacks.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: A young Mormon missionary has survived three terrorist attacks in three countries.

title: Police Say Meth Has Been Contaminated with Ebola
subtitle: A police department shared a humorous but fake message asking meth users to bring in their drugs to be checked for Ebola contamination.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Police are asking meth users to bring in their drugs because they might be contaminated with Ebola.

title: Keith Richards Pulled a Knife on Donald Trump
subtitle: Claims about Rolling Stones guitarist Keith Richards' threatening Donald Trump with a knife back in 1989 are exaggerated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Keith Richards once pulled a knife on Donald Trump.

title: Does Zantac Cause False Positives for Methamphetamines?
subtitle: Rumors that ranitidine causes false positives for meth in drug screening have circulated for years, but the conditions under which this would happen are extremely rare.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Zantac (ranitidine) or similar acid reflux medications cause users to falsely test positive for meth use.

title: Sasha and Malia Obama's Dresses Cost Taxpayers $20,000 Each?
subtitle: Several articles reported that Sasha and Malia Obama wore dresses worth $20,000 each to a state dinner - and that taxpayers picked up the tab.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Taxpayers paid more than $40,000 for Sasha and Malia Obama's state dinner dresses.

title: Bernie Sanders Isn't Planning to Ban Trucks in the United States
subtitle: While Bernie Sanders has said he plans to improve the United States' rail system to combat climate change, he has not called for a ban on trucks.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bernie Sanders plans on banning trucks in the United States.

title: Is Kentucky Banning Interracial Marriages?
subtitle: Despite rumors spawned by a vaguely-worded bill, Kentucky has neither banned nor attempted to ban interracial marriage.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Kentucky has passed a bill banning interracial marriages.

title: 'Moving to Canada' Search Spike?
subtitle: Google said search queries about moving to Canada spiked on Super Tuesday, but that spike didn't seem to crash Canada's immigration website by itself.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The volume of Americans researching the details of immigrating to Canada was so high on Super Tuesday that it temporarily crashed the country's immigration site.

title: Bernie Sanders on Institutional Racism
subtitle: A quote from Bernie Sanders about institutional racism was taken out of context by both pro-Sanders and anti-Sanders groups.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bernie Sanders said that white people don't know what it is like to be poor.

title: Donald Trump Isn't Hiring a Latina Actress to Play His Assistant
subtitle: A casting call for "Donald Trump Executive Assistant Supporter" probably wasn't posted by the Republican candidate's Presidential campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A casting call for a Latina actress to play a "Donald Trump Executive Assistant Supporter" was posted by the republican presidential candidate.

title: Hitler and Trump: Common Slogans?
subtitle: Various images attempted to connect Donald Trump and Adolf Hitler through slogans promising to make their respective countries "great again."
author: Dan Evon
statement: As the Nazi Party rose to power, Hitler used the slogan "Make Germany Great Again."

title: O.J. Simpson Case Knife Claim
subtitle: Los Angeles police are looking into whether a knife purportedly found on the grounds of O.J. Simpson's former home was connected to the 1994 murders of Nicole Brown and Ron Goldman.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A bloody knife was recently uncovered on the grounds of O.J. Simpson's former home.

title: Does Hand Size Actually Correlate to Penis Size?
subtitle: Donald Trump said that if his hands are small, "something else" must be small, but that claim isn't exactly true.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: You can tell the size of a man's penis by looking at his hands.

title: Did Bill Clinton Violate Campaign Laws in MA?
subtitle: Bill Clinton's appearance at Massachusetts polling places warranted a caution from the state, but officials believed no laws were broken.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bill Clinton potentially violated Massachusetts election laws by entering polling places on Super Tuesday.

title: Is Discarding Your Boarding Pass Dangerous?
subtitle: Facebook posts claim airline boarding passes are encoded with sensitive personal information, but the risks involved in discarding them are vastly overstated.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Thieves can obtain your home address, banking details, e-mail address, phone number, and other personal details from discarded boarding passes.

title: Was Donald Trump's Father Arrested at a KKK Rally?
subtitle: A 1927 New York Times article about KKK arrests mentioned Donald Trump's father Fred, but the reporting was vague and inconclusive.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump's father was arrested following a Ku Klux Klan-related altercation in 1927.

title: The 'World's Cutest Rodent'?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly showing "the world's cutest rodent" is a felt doll, but its real counterpart does exist.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows "the world's cutest rodent," a Baluchistan pygmy jerboa.

title: Illinois Single Mother Birth Certificate Controversy
subtitle: A controversial bill proposed in Illinois could make obtaining a birth certificate more difficult for single mothers, but the provision was related to government assistance, not morality.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Lawmakers in Illinois proposed a bill to prevent single mothers from obtaining birth certificates for their children.

title: Exit Poll Says 20 Percent of Trump Supporters are Pro-Slavery?
subtitle: An article in the New York Times' 'The Upshot' maintained one in five Trump supporters opposed freeing slaves after the Civil War.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Nearly 20 percent of Donald Trump's voters disagreed with the freeing of slaves in Southern states after the Civil War.

title: Did Donald Trump Supporters Wear KKK Robes to the Nevada Caucus?
subtitle: While photos show two people in Ku Klux Klan robes showing support for Donald Trump at the Nevada caucus, it's unclear if they were actually members of the KKK.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows two Ku Klux Klan members dressed in white robes showing support for Donald Trump at the Nevada caucus.

title: Hitchhiker Killed by Muslims?
subtitle: An article published in 2016 reporting that a hitchhiking woman was raped and murdered by Muslims is inaccurate and based on an incident from 2008.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A woman was raped and murdered in Turkey during a trek for "world peace."

title: John Kasich 'Women and Kitchens' Controversy
subtitle: A clip depicted John Kasich talking about women coming "out of kitchens," but Kasich was referencing a decades-old grassroots campaign effort.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: John Kasich said he won elections because women came out of their kitchens to vote for him.

title: Did California Pass a Law Allowing Undocumented Immigrants to Vote in Federal Elections?
subtitle: California did pass a law intended to increase voter turnout, but the state has not made it legal for undocumented residents to vote.
author: Dan Evon
statement: California has passed a law allowing undocumented residents to vote.

title: Bill Maher Smokes a Joint on 'Real Time'?
subtitle: Bill Maher appeared to genuinely smoke a joint during a February 2016 taping of 'Real Time with Bill Maher,' but the FCC isn't fining him.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Bill Maher smoked a joint during a live broadcast of 'Real Time with Bill Maher,' and the FCC imposed a hefty fine.

title: Marine Assaulted at McDonald's by Black Lives Matter Activists?
subtitle: Marine veteran Christopher Marquez was involved in an altercation at a Washington, D.C., McDonald's, but police said there was no indication the argument involved Black Lives Matter activists.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Marine vet Christopher Marquez was assaulted at a Washington, D.C., McDonald's retaurant by Black Lives Matter activists.

title: Man Arrested for Not Paying Student Loans?
subtitle: A story about a man being arrested for not paying a student loan is circulating on the internet - but without all of the facts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Marshals are arresting people who have not paid their student loans.

title: Donald Trump Taunts Jeb Bush on Twitter over Domain?
subtitle: JebBush.com redirects to the web site of Donald Trump, but a purported tweet from Trump taunting Bush didn't come from Trump's official account.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump boasted in a tweet that Jeb Bush failed to renew his domain registration, enabling Trump's campaign to redirect it to Trump's web site.

title: Photograph Shows Rhinoceros Trying to Save Zebra Foal?
subtitle: While a photograph does show a rhinoceros interacting with a zebra foal, the image doesn't tell the complete (and far less uplifting) story.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a rhinoceros saving a zebra foal.

title: Are California Fruits Irrigated with Toxic Fracking Wastewater?
subtitle: A number of social media and blog posts claimed that some California fruits were grown in toxic fracking-related or oil refinery wastewater.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Produce in California (namely tangerines) is being grown in toxic wastewater from oil company fracking activities.

title: Antonin Scalia Death Penalty Quote
subtitle: Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia didn't quite say that factual innocence of the accused was irrelevant in death penalty cases.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia said "mere factual innocence is no reason not to carry out a death sentence properly reached."

title: Was a 'Do You Want to Play with My Balls?' Book Intended for Children?
subtitle: A book featuring amusing ball-related double entendres is a parody of children's books and is not targeted at youngsters.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A book titled "Do You Want to Play with My Balls?" was published for children.

title: Abraham Lincoln Didn't Quit
subtitle: Abraham Lincoln wasn't a quitter, but he also didn't quite experience a steady stream of failure and defeat before becoming President of the United States.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Abraham Lincoln endured a steady stream of failure and defeat before becoming President of the United States.

title: Is This What Happens When You Park in a Handicapped Parking Spot in Brazil?
subtitle: A video showing the creative shaming of a motorist who illegally parked in a handicapped spot was created by the YouTube comedy team Canal Boom.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows a group of citizens teaching a lesson to person who parked illegally in a handicapped parking spot.

title: Do Glittery Phone Cases Cause Acid Burns?
subtitle: After anecdotal reports of glitter iPhone cases causing burns in 2016, one manufacturer recalled over a quarter of a million cases in August 2017.
author: Brooke Binkowski
statement: Glittery phone cases are leaking some type of substance that causes chemical burns.

title: Does Febreze Contain Peanut Oil?
subtitle: Social media users shared anecdotal reports of undeclared peanut and tree nut oils or byproducts in Febreze and other Procter & Gamble products, but P&G stated their non-food items are either appropriately labeled or nut-free.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Febreze and other Procter & Gamble products contain undeclared peanut and tree nut oils or byproducts, posing a risk to individuals with nut allergies.

title: Is This a Photograph of a Whisky Vending Machine?
subtitle: Buying alcoholic drinks from vending machines wasn't as common as is now believed.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A vintage photograph shows a common workplace item from the 1960s: A whisky vending machine.

title: Bernie Sanders: A Loser's Life?
subtitle: A meme about Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders displayed questionable accuracy and relevance.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme accurately describes the arc of Bernie Sanders' (financial) life.

title: Signs Warning Drivers about Distracted Walkers Were Installed by Artists
subtitle: The artists installed the signs in Sweden to warn drivers about people crossing streets while staring at their phones.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Sweden has installed road signs to warn drivers about distracted walkers.

title: Was Trump Nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize?
subtitle: A trending Facebook topic led many to believe in 2016 that Donald Trump was slated to receive a Nobel Peace Prize, but the news was more than a little premature.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump has been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Iowa Caucus Coin Toss
subtitle: Iowa's quirky caucus conventions drew national attention over the involvement of literal coin tosses to allocate votes between Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: During the Iowa caucuses, delegates are sometimes awarded through coin tosses, and Hillary Clinton won six coin tosses in the 2016 caucuses (awarding her a narrow victory).

title: Cancelled: So-Called 'Make Rape Legal' International Event
subtitle: A controversial men's rights activist advertised "tribal meetings" spanning multiple countries, but the event has now been canceled.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Men's rights activist "Roosh V" organized a "make rape legal" event across 43 countries on 6 February 2016.

title: Bernie Sanders Pays Interns $12 an Hour?
subtitle: Bernie Sanders has been criticized as hypocritical for only paying his interns $12 an hour despite his campaigning to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Bernie Sanders pays his staff interns $12 per hour while campaigning for a minimum wage increase to $15 per hour.

title: Trump Plans to Reverse Marriage Equality as President?
subtitle: Donald Trump addressed the topic of the Supreme Court's marriage equality decision during a January 2016 Fox News appearance.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump said he'd overturn the Supreme Court's marriage equality decision if elected president.

title: Some Concerned Over Trump Veteran Donations
subtitle: While money raised during an event for veterans was donated to the Donald J. Trump Foundation, it was eventually given to various veterans' charities and not used for his presidential campaign.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The donations raised during a benefit event for veterans went to Donald J. Trump's personal foundation instead of veteran charities.

title: Dick Morris on Hillary Clinton
subtitle: Former Clinton White House advisor Dick Morris made several assertions about Hillary Clinton in a column that was subsequently circulated as an e-mail forward.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A column written by Clinton adviser-turned-opponent Dick Morris pointed out details elided in a 2007 Hillary Clinton campaign ad narrated by President Bill Clinton.

title: Vermin Supreme
subtitle: An individual named Vermin Supreme continually runs for office but openly remains a performance artist, rather than a serious candidate.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A candidate named Vermin Supreme is running for President in 2016 on a platform of free ponies for everyone.

title: Did a Trump Spokeswoman Say Obama Was 'Head Negro' and Not a 'Pure Breed'?
subtitle: Donald Trump spokeswoman Katrina Pierson previously made some racially charged remarks about President Obama on Twitter.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump's spokeswoman Katrina Pierson called President Obama the 'head negro in charge.'

title: Utility Pole Buried in Snow
subtitle: A photograph shows a utility pole that has been buried in snow, but the amount of snow is a matter of dispute.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a man standing next to a utility pole that has been buried in 40 feet of snow.

title: Height of the Texas Giants
subtitle: A photograph shows four Texas brothers who were all said to be nearly 8 feet tall, but their actual heights are still debated.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows 'The Texas Giants,' four brothers who were all nearly 8 feet tall.

title: Goldwater Girl
subtitle: Hillary Clinton supported Barry Goldwater in 1964, but she didn't vote for a candidate who vowed to "re-segregate" America.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: In 1964, Hillary Clinton campaigned and voted for Barry Goldwater, who promised to overturn the Civil Rights Act and "re-segregate" America.

title: Is Gasoline Cheaper Under President Obama?
subtitle: Whether or not they have ties to the oil industry, U.S. presidents have little control over the price of gasoline.
author: Stephanie Larsen
statement: Gasoline prices have been dramatically lower during the Obama administration than the Bush administration because Obama has no ties to the oil and gas industries.

title: Were the Remains of U.S. Soldiers Dumped in a Landfill?
subtitle: A report from 2011 about the cremated partial remains of 274 soldiers being dumped in a landfill popped up again several years later.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The remains of more than 250 soldiers were dumped in a landfill between 2004 and 2008, a fact that was ignored by the mainstream media.

title: Obama Did Not Wear Shutter Shades After 2016 SOTU
subtitle: A photograph showing President Obama wearing American flag glasses was not taken after the 2016 State of the Union address.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows President Obama wearing American flag glasses after the 2016 State Of The Union Address.

title: Does a Photograph Show Pigs Forced Into Tiny Cages?
subtitle: An outrage-provoking photograph showing pigs confined in confiningly small cages is real, but the accompanying description of it is inaccurate.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows the living conditions of a group of pigs.

title: Virginia GOP Bill Would Require Schools to Verify Children's Genitals Before Using the Restroom?
subtitle: A controversial bill proposed by Virginia lawmaker Mark Cole proposed stricter policing of "anatomical sex" in the state's school bathrooms but didn't mandate genital checks.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A Virginia lawmaker proposed a bill that mandates on-site physical examinations of children's genitals to determine which gendered bathroom they're authorized to use.

title: 'Sperm Switch' Invention Not Ready For Market
subtitle: A German company is getting closer to producing Bimek SLV, also called the "sperm switch," but the male contraception product is not currently available for purchase.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A new male contraception product allows a man to control the flow of sperm by flicking a switch.

title: iPhone 7 Headphone Jack Controversy
subtitle: Rumors that the iPhone 7 will lack a headphone jack began in late 2015, with later versions accusing Apple of a shakedown.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Apple is eliminating the headphone jack for iPhone 7 in order to force users to purchase expensive Bluetooth equipment or proprietary headphones.

title: Wendy's $1 'Free Frosty' Key Tag?
subtitle: There were more questions than answers on social media about Wendy's $1 Frosty Key Tag promotion.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can get free Wendy's Frostys all year long if you purchase a $1 Frosty Key Tag.

title: Rep. Josh Moore's Breastfeeding Comment
subtitle: New Hampshire state representative Josh Moore made an inappropriate remark regarding women breastfeeding in public, but his comments were exaggerated in a fake news article.
author: Dan Evon
statement: New Hampshire state representative Josh Moore said that a woman shouldn't breastfeed in public if she doesn't want to be groped by men.

title: Did the U.S. Remove 'Country of Origin' Labeling from Meat?
subtitle: A meme about the purported removal of "country of origin" labeling on meat contained a mixture of true and false information.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Lawmakers "slipped" the repeal of country of origin labeling for meat into the December 2015 Omnibus Appropriations Bill.

title: JC Penney Fairview Heights Flag Controversy
subtitle: A Facebook user claimed the JC Penney Portrait Studio in Fairview Heights, Illinois refused to take a photo with an American flag because it "went against their belief."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The JC Penney Portrait Studio in Fairview Heights, Illinois refused to take a photo with an American flag because it "went against their belief."

title: Hope Farm Owners Threatened by Refugees
subtitle: A group of asylum-seekers and refugees staying at Hope Farm in South Africa threatened owners Andrew and Rae Wartnaby.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Muslim Refugees threatened to slaughter their hosts at Hope Farms in South Africa.

title: New NYC Laws Prohibit Discrimination Against Transgender Community
subtitle: New York City has released new guidelines regulating discrimination on the basis of gender identity.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Property owners in New York City will be fined $250,000 for using "improper pronouns" due to new transgender laws.

title: Some College Students Sign Petition To Ban Song 'White Christmas'
subtitle: A reporter got several college students to sign a fake petition to ban the song "White Christmas."
author: Dan Evon
statement: College students are petitioning to get the song "White Christmas" banned due to racism.

title: Photograph of Cliff Hanger Isn't Quite What It Seems
subtitle: A deceptive photograph seemingly shows a man perilously hanging from the edge of a high cliff.  He's actually in no danger at all.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A deceptive photograph shows a man perilously hanging by his feet from the edge of a high cliff.

title: Former Marine's Letter to Michelle Obama
subtitle: A former Marine's open letter to Michelle Obama is frequently shared with misleading information.
author: Dan Evon
statement: After being challenged by Michelle Obama, a former Marine wrote the First Lady a scathing letter.

title: Bernie Sanders Campaign Data Breach Controversy
subtitle: A brief campaign software glitch led to what the DNC said was improper access of records by Bernie Sanders' campaign.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Staffers on Bernie Sanders' campaign deliberately and improperly accessed information about the Hillary Clinton campaign during a brief (30-40 minute-long) data security lapse.

title: Was the Arapahoe School Shooting Stopped by an Armed School Official?
subtitle: A graphic about a 2013 school shooting in Arapahoe that was prevented by an armed school resource officer is inaccurate in some key aspects.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A December 2015 school shooting in Arapahoe County, Colorado, was circumvented by an armed school resource officer.

title: Did Obama Give Syria $195 Million to Celebrate a Muslim Holiday?
subtitle: The White House announced in 2013 that the U.S. would provide an additional $195 million for food and humanitarian aide to Syria, not for the celebration of a Muslim holiday.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Obama gave Syria $195 million to celebrate a Muslim holiday.

title: Bill Nye Booed in Waco?
