subtitle: A 2006 presentation by Bill Nye the Science Guy Received Mixed Reactions In Waco, Texas.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Residents in Waco, Texas booed Bill Nye The Science Guy for saying that the moon reflects light from the sun.

title: Ferrero Rocher Chocolates Filled with Maggots?
subtitle: Viral videos showing Ferrero Rocher chocolates crawling with insects are real but not evidence of a manufacturing problem.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Viral videos shows Ferrero Rocher chocolates crawling with maggots .

title: Does a HIPAA 'Medical Hack' Avoid Insurance Claim Denials?
subtitle: A "HIPAA medical hack" likely won't help you circumvent a denial of coverage notice issued by your health insurer.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Patients can circumvent insurance company claim denials by requesting a specific form of documentation, as the insurance company will opt to simply cover the cost rather than provide the paperwork.

title: Did Jack Johnson Invent the Monkey Wrench?
subtitle: Popular memes assert that former heavyweight champion Jack Johnson invented the monkey wrench, and that it was so named as a racial slur.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The term "monkey wrench" was originally used to insult the tool's African-American inventor, Jack Johnson.

title: Did a North Carolina Town Reject Solar Panels?
subtitle: During a public comment period, citizens expressed strong feelings about the technology.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Residents of a North Carolina town rejected the local installation of a solar farm over fears the technology was harmful.

title: Angry Atheists Ban the Bible?
subtitle: The FFRF and the ACLJ are sparring over the matter of Bibles in hotel rooms.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Atheists are trying to ban Bibles from all hotel rooms.

title: Prophet Mohammed London Buses
subtitle: A Facebook post asserted that the British government banned the Lord's Prayer in cinemas, but then allowed Islamic messages to be displayed on London buses.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The British government banned the Lord's Prayer in cinemas but then allowed Islamic messages to appear on London buses.

title: Jimmy Carter Banned Iranian Immigrants
subtitle: Did President Jimmy Carter ban Iranian nationals from entering the U.S. in a manner similar to Donald Trump's proposed ban on Muslims?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: President Jimmy Carter banned Iranian nationals from entering the U.S. in a manner similar to Donald Trump's proposal to ban the entry of  Muslims.

title: Trump Wants to Shut Down the Internet?
subtitle: Donald Trump made some confusing remarks about an internet shutdown or ban, but he appeared to be describing a counterterror plan.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump stated he would contact Bill Gates to shut down or ban the internet.

title: Did Buffalo Wild Wings Ban Guns and Refuse Service to Armed Police?
subtitle: A zombie controversy over police and guns at Buffalo Wild Wings was reanimated in November 2015, for no apparent reason.
author: Kim LaCapria

title: Does FEMA Use Waffle House Closures to Determine How Bad a Disaster Is?
subtitle: FEMA's informal "Waffle House Index" disaster measurement metric exists, but it isn't as integral as rumors have suggested.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) uses an index based on Waffle House closures to determine the severity of natural disasters.

title: Did Trump Say Muslims Should Be Required to Wear Badges?
subtitle: Donald Trump was inaccurately reported as asserting that Muslims should wear ID badges, a claim that drew inevitable comparisons to Adolf Hitler.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Donald Trump stated that Muslims should be made to wear identifying badges.

title: Did the Boston Marathon Bombers Enter the U.S. as Refugees?
subtitle: The Boston Marathon bombing perpetrators were often described as refugees, but their family actually entered the U.S. on tourist visas.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Boston Marathon bombers Tamerlan and Dzokhar Tsarnaev entered the United States as refugees.

title: What is This Soldier Photographed with Hillary Clinton Signaling?
subtitle: He told us the story behind the viral photograph.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows a soldier crossing his fingers to signal he was coerced into posing with Hillary Clinton.

title: Anonymous OpKKK
subtitle: Anonymous-linked social media accounts claimed to have discovered prominent politicians in the ranks of the Ku Klux Klan, but they didn't release any confirming information.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Anonymous has discovered evidence that numerous politicians have Ku Klux Klan connections.

title: Did Ben Carson's Family Benefit from Welfare?
subtitle: Memes assert Ben Carson benefited from welfare early in life, only to say such programs caused the "disintegration of the family unit" and "enslav[ed] African-Americans."
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dr. Ben Carson said the "disintegration of the family unit and the welfare state are enslaving African-Americans and ruining their futures" but received help from such programs in his youth.

title: Did the CDC 'Admit' 98 Million Americans Were Given a 'Cancer Virus' via the Polio Shot?
subtitle: Much ado about nothing: The CDC didn't 'admit' anyone contracted cancer from polio vaccinations, nor did they 'disappear' information about that topic.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The CDC quietly removed pages from their web site that admitted a link between Simian Virus 40 (SV40), the polio vaccine, and cancer.

title: Back to the Future Rumors and Predictions
subtitle: On "Back to the Future" day, a variety of rumors about BTTF's vision of life in 2015 were prominent on social media.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Multiple social media rumors circulated on Back to the Future Day (21 October 2015): that Michael J. Fox was arrested for "insider sports betting," that Nike delivered a pair of self-tying sneakers, and that the Biff Tannen character was based on Donald Trump.

title: Dueling Memes Debate Denmark's Social Infrastructure
subtitle: Contrasting memes describe the benefits and downside of living within the Danish social system.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A pair of memes accurately describes the benefits and downside of the social system in Denmark.

title: Is Six Flags Closing Their Theme Parks to the Public to Host 'Muslim Family Day?'
subtitle: Six Flags theme parks host a number of different events every year.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Six Flags is temporarily closing one or more of their theme parks to the public to host "Muslim Family Day."

title: Did an Armed Vice Principal Stop the Pearl High School Shooter?
subtitle: Let's look at the facts.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Did President Obama Plea Bargain Gun Trafficker Dontray Mills?
subtitle: Dontray Mills was charged with 55 gun trafficking offenses and escaped jail time because a federal judge gave him probation, not because President Obama plea bargained him.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A man named Dontray Mills was convicted of multiple gun trafficking offenses but was pardoned by President Obama.

title: Are Oreo Cookies Now Produced in Mexico?
subtitle: While Oreo's parent company is eliminating some jobs in Chicago, production of the cookie isn't moving to Mexico.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Nabisco closed their Chicago plant and moved all production of Oreos to Mexico.

title: Did Will Smith Donate $150,000 to a 'Terrorist Organization'?
subtitle: The celebrity couple reportedly gave $150,000 to help support the 2015 "Justice or Else! Million Man March."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith donated $150,000 to a "black Muslim" who called for the murder of all whites.

title: The Black Dot Campaign
subtitle: Can victims of domestic violence secretly signal for help by drawing black dots on their palms?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Victims of domestic violence can effectively send out a secret signal for help by drawing black dots on their palms.

title: Downy Unstopables Warmer Warning
subtitle: Procter and Gamble doesn't recommend using Downy Unstopables in a wax warmer, but the practice probably won't kill you.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: It's dangerous to put Downy Unstopables (or other laundry fragrance beads) in a tart or wax warmer.

title: Was a High School Band Ordered to Stop Performing 'How Great Thou Art'?
subtitle: A federal judge issued an order enjoining the use of religious material in high school events, not a specific ban on 'How Great Thou Art.'
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A federal judge ordered Brandon High School in Mississippi to remove the hymn "How Great Thou Art" from its marching band's halftime show.

title: Are New 'Super' Lice Spreading Across the U.S.?
subtitle: The problem of mutated head lice wasn't necessarily a new one.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A new strain of treatment-resistant "super lice" is spreading to dozens of states.

title: Would Donald Trump Deport His Children?
subtitle: Would four of Donald Trump's five children have been subject to deportation under his immigration reform proposal ending birthright citizenship?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Four of Donald Trump's children would have been deported under his strict policy proposal against birthright citizenship.

title: Connor Reid Eckhardt
subtitle: Was a California teen named Connor Reid Eckhardt determined to have died after smoking a synthetic marijuana compound known as "spice" or K2?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A California teen named Connor Reid Eckhardt was determined to have died after smoking a synthetic marijuana compound known as "spice" or K2.

title: Do Windmills Consume More Energy to Build Than They Ever Produce?
subtitle: Thomas Homer-Dixon did not argue that windmills never recoup the energy it takes to build them.
author: Dan Evon
statement: According to Thomas Homer-Dixon, wind turbines never recoup the energy it takes to build them.

title: Do Democrats Want to Ban the POW/MIA Flag Because It Is 'Racist'?
subtitle: A controversial opinion piece published in 'Newsweek' magazine sparked some confusion.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Democrats are trying to ban the POW/MIA flag because it is racist.

title: Does the NAACP Want to Sandblast Confederate Figures Off Stone Mountain?
subtitle: One of many rumors that arose during a national debate on the appropriateness of Confederate monuments and memorials.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The NAACP is calling for the removal of an historical Civil War carving from Stone Mountain, Georgia.

title: Are Mutated Daisies Growing Near Fukushima?
subtitle: A photograph purportedly shows mutated Shasta daisies growing near the Fukushima nuclear power plant in Japan.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a group of daisies that mutated due to radiation from the Fukushima nuclear power plant.

title: Is China Re-Shipping Processed Chickens Back to the U.S.?
subtitle: Chinese plants received the go-ahead to export processed chickens products to the U.S. in 2013. But are they buying chickens and shipping them back to us?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Chinese plants are processing chickens raised by Tyson in the U.S. and shipping them back to America.

title: Does This Video Prove Planned Parenthood Sells Fetal Tissue Illegally?
subtitle: It's unclear why the video was held for over a year before it was released, and it has some curious aspects to it.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A video shows Dr. Deborah Nucatola admitting that Planned Parenthood engages in the illegal sale of tissue from aborted fetuses.

title: Did HarperCollins Remove 45 Complete Verses from the NIV Bible?
subtitle: Supposedly "missing verses” in the NIV Bible were simply moved to footnotes in order to distinguish between elements from older and newer texts.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Publisher HarperCollins has removed 45 complete verses from the NIV (New International Version) Bible.

title: Did Donald Trump Say He'd Like to Date His Daughter?
subtitle: "It's a sense of humor that people don't see from him all the time."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Donald Trump said that he'd like to date his daughter Ivanka.

title: Pizza Vending Machines
subtitle: Rumors of the imminent arrival of pizza vending machines swept social media in mid-2015, but those machines have been "coming soon" for several years now.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can now order pizza from pizza vending machines.

title: The Truth About Confederate History: Part 1
subtitle: Misinformation about the antebellum South, the Civil War, and the Confederate flag is rife on the internet.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A list dispels 'falsehoods and inaccuracies of Confederate and Southern history.'

title: Dogs as Shark Bait?
subtitle: Are fisherman on Réunion Island employing live dogs as bait for shark-fishing?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Fisherman on Réunion Island employ live dogs as bait for shark-fishing.

title: Irena Sendler
subtitle: Irena Sendler, supposedly a candidate for the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize, is credited with saving 2,500 Polish Jews from the Holocaust.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Irena Sendler, credited with saving 2,500 Polish Jews from the Holocaust, was a candidate for the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize but lost out to Al Gore.

title: Congress Voted to Sell Apache Land to Foreign Corporation?
subtitle: Controversial congressional measure reportedly gave sacred Apache land to an environmentally harmful foreign corporation.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Congress voted to give Apache land to an environmentally exploitative foreign corporation.

title: Did the FDA Admit That 70% of U.S. Chickens Contain Arsenic?
subtitle: The Food and Drug Administration actually said some chicken meat may contain small amounts of arsenic.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The FDA admitted in 2015 that 70% of chickens sold for food in the U.S. contain cancer-causing arsenic.

title: Is Breast Milk Gold Under a Microscope?
subtitle: An intriguing image of breast milk under high magnification shows it to be glittery gold in appearance.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A photograph of breast milk under a microscope appears glittery gold.

title: Are Rhinos and Elephants Getting Pink Horns to Prevent Poaching?
subtitle: The use of a pink dye to prevent the poaching of species such as elephants and rhinos is not quite as depicted in popular online images.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A photograph shows a rhino that was given a pink horn to prevent poaching.

title: Cheating at the Gas Pump
subtitle: Account reports an instance of a customer being cheated by a malfunctioning gas pump.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Account reports instances of customers being cheated by malfunctioning gas pumps.

title: Did CNN's Brooke Baldwin Say Military Veterans Can't Be Trusted with Authority?
subtitle: The CNN newsperson supposedly proclaimed that local law enforcement shouldn't hire military veterans because they 'can't be trusted with authority.'
author: Dan Evon
statement: CNN reporter Brooke Baldwin said "don't hire veterans, they can't be trusted with authority."

title: Do CFL Light Bulbs Emit Harmful Levels of Radiation?
subtitle: CFL light bulbs are claimed to be dangerous compared to conventional incandescent bulbs because they emit higher levels of radiation.
author: Dan Evon
statement: CFL light bulbs are dangerous compared to conventional incandescent bulbs because they emit higher levels of radiation.

title: Big Store Price Codes
subtitle: 'Secret lists' supposedly reveal the hidden price tag coding to bargains at Target and Costco stores.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: 'Secret lists' reveal price tag coding at Target and Costco stores.

title: The Sound of Apocalypse
subtitle: Are people hearing strange apocalyptic sounds coming from the sky all around the world?
author: Dan Evon
statement: Videos have captured strange apocalyptic sounds coming from the sky all around the world.

title: Do PLU Codes Document How Produce Is Grown?
subtitle: The numeric codes found on produce stickers may or may not reliably identify how those produce items were grown.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Numeric PLU codes used on produce stickers identify how food products were grown.

title: U.S. Flags Exempt from Sales Taxes
subtitle: Whether or not you pay sales tax when purchasing American flags depends on what state you live in.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Purchases of U.S. flags are exempt from sales taxes.

title: Pastor Disguises Himself as Homeless Man
subtitle: Legend: New pastor secretly poses as homeless man, then reveals himself to unsympathetic congregants.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Did a holy man disguise himself as homeless in order to test the compassion of his congregation?

title: Boston Marathon Bombing Rumors
subtitle: A collection of rumors and conspiracy theories associated with the Boston Marathon bombing.
author: David Mikkelson

title: How to Survive a Heart Attack When Alone
subtitle: Rhythmically coughing during a heart attack may increase your chances of surviving it, but self-undertaking that procedure can be problematic.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Rhythmically coughing during a heart attack increases your chances of surviving it.

title: Three Simple Tests to Detect a Stroke
subtitle: Rumor: Administering three simple tests will help diagnose a stroke, and pricking a stroke victim's fingers will prevent further harm from the cerebral attack.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Administering three simple tests will help diagnose a stroke, and pricking a stroke victim's fingers will prevent further harm from the cerebral attack.

title: Has Animal Testing Resumed for Avon, Mary Kay, and Estée Lauder?
subtitle: Animal testing for cosmetics is a hot topic in the beauty industry, with some consumers deciding to avoid products made with animal testing.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Cosmetic companies Avon, Mary Kay and Estée Lauder have resumed testing their products on animals after previously abandoning the practice.

title: Can WD-40 Really Do All That?
subtitle: Do 45 life hacks listed here, including deterring pigeons, only require a can of WD-40?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Article lists a variety of household uses for WD-40 brand spray lubricant.

title: Are These Unusual Houses Real?
subtitle: Photographs show a collection of houses located in unusual places.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photographs show a collection of houses built in unusual places.

title: Is Expired Cake Mix Dangerous?
subtitle: Are expired boxes of cake and pancake mixes dangerously toxic?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Expired boxes of cake and pancake mix are dangerously toxic.

subtitle: Rumor: Muslim men living in Michigan can receive welfare assistance for up to four wives.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Should You Use Wasp Spray for Self-Defense?
subtitle: Is a can of wasp spray a preferable alternative to pepper spray for protection against assailants?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A can of wasp spray is a preferable alternative to pepper spray for protection against assailants.

title: Does Mountain Dew Contain the 'Dangerous Chemical' BVO?
subtitle: Brominated vegetable oil (BVO) is yet another common food additive that has come under scrutiny from food safety proponents.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Mountain Dew and other sodas contain a dangerous chemical known as brominated vegetable oil (BVO).

title: Insect Spy Drone
subtitle: A photograph purportedly shows a miniature insect spy drone that can take photographs and DNA samples.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A photograph shows an insect spy drone that can take photographs and DNA samples.

title: Does Marijuana Contain More Tar Than Cigarettes?
subtitle: Marijuana may contain more tar than tobacco-based cigarettes, but that doesn't necessarily mean the health risks of smoking it are greater.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Marijuana cigarettes deposit four times more tar into smokers' lungs than tobacco-based cigarettes.

title: Did Obama Say 'Muslims Built the Fabric of Our Nation'?

author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Obama said that "Muslims built the very fabric of our nation."

title: Is 69% of All Olive Oil Fake?
subtitle: Did a study show that 69% of all store-bought extra virgin olive oils in the U.S. are 'probably fake'?
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: A study showed 69% of all store-bought extra virgin olive oils in the US are 'probably fake.'

title: Can 'Illegal Immigrants' Claim $24,000 'Amnesty Bonuses'?
subtitle: The Earned Income Tax Credit targets low- and moderate-income families, especially those with children.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Changes to immigration policy announced in November 2014 make "illegal immigrants" eligible to collect $24,000 "amnesty bonuses."

title: Abraham Lincoln and Failure
subtitle: Legend: Abraham Lincoln endured a steady stream of failure and defeat before becoming President of the United States.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Dog Years vs. Human Years

statement: Video clip shows an elephant painting a picture of an elephant.

title: Nine Tips - Written by a Cop
subtitle: A list of nine crime safety tips supposedly written by a cop contains a mixture of good and bad advice.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A list of safety tips offers effective counters to being victimized in random violent crimes.

title: Is This List of Changes to Social Security Over the Years Real?
subtitle: The Social Security system has been subject to debate for many decades.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: List details changes made to the Social Security system over the years.

title: School Buses
subtitle: Photograph purportedly shows school buses caught in a flooded New Orleans parking lot because no one ordered them to be deployed to evacuate residents ahead of Hurricane Katrina.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Photograph shows school buses caught in a flooded New Orleans parking lot because no one ordered them to be deployed to evacuate residents ahead of Hurricane Katrina.

title: 'If I Were the Devil'
subtitle: An essay that postulates what steps the devil might take in order to corrupt human civilization was popularized by radio commentator Paul Harvey.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A transcript reproduces radio commentator Paul Harvey's essay entitled "If I Were the Devil."

title: Are Drug-Laced Suckers Being Handed Out to Children?
subtitle: It appears a valid report about drugs confiscated by the police fell into the hands of someone with an active imagination.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Drug-laced suckers are being handed out to children in Arkansas.

title: Was the Weight of a Human Soul Determined to Be 21 Grams?
subtitle: No credence should be given to the notion that experiments intended to measure the weight of a human soul proved anything.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A physician once placed dying patients upon a scale and determined the weight of the human soul to be 21 grams.

title: Did Rush Limbaugh Utter All These 'Racist' Statements?
subtitle: A list purportedly documenting racially questionable statements made by the conservative radio talk show host is lacking in evidence.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A list documents racist statements made by conservative radio talk show host Rush Limbaugh.

title: Will Bananas Be Extinct in Ten Years?
subtitle: Several hundred different varieties of the fruit, and the reported fear applies to only one of them, the Cavendish.
statement: Bananas will be extinct within ten years.

title: Did a Man Safely 'Surf' Down from the Upper Levels of the WTC on 9/11?
subtitle: Rumor holds that a man survived a multi-story fall from the World Trade Center, riding down on the explosion like a surfer.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A man caught in the explosion of one of the World Trade Center towers rode bits of the falling building down to safety.

title: How Did These Famous and Powerful Men of 1923 Fare?
subtitle: An essay details the sad fates of rich and powerful men from 1923.  How true is it?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An essay details the sad fates of rich and powerful men from 1923.

title: Can Texas Divide Itself into Five Separate States?
subtitle: Some interesting debate took place around the Texas Annexation.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Texas can by law choose to divide itself into five different states.

title: Did Members of Led Zeppelin Pleasure a Groupie with a Mud Shark?
subtitle: Tales of sexual exploits involving groupies and animals are familiar entries in the Led Zeppelin canon of rumors.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Members of Led Zeppelin once employed a mud shark on a female groupie.

title: Is Using Cruise Control on Wet Roads Dangerous?
subtitle: Snow, ice, slush, or even rain can cause wheel-spin and loss of control, situations to which drivers must react quickly.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Using cruise control on wet roads or during heavy rain can cause you to lose control of your vehicle.

title: Why Are U.S. Flags Folded 13 Times?
subtitle: There is no shortage of scripts available that can be read aloud during a flag folding.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The folding of a U.S. flag traditionally incorporates thirteen separate folds because each of the folds has a special meaning.

title: Did David Bowie's Wife Say She Caught Him in Bed with Mick Jagger?
subtitle: "I caught him in bed with men several times. In fact the best time I caught him in bed was with Mick Jagger."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: David Bowie's wife said she once caught him in bed with Mick Jagger.

title: Are U.S. Railroad Gauges Based on Roman Chariots?
subtitle: The eventual standardization of railroad gauge in the U.S. was due far less to a slavish devotion to a gauge inherited from England than to the simple fact that the North won the Civil War.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.S. standard railroad gauge derives directly from the width of Imperial Roman war chariots.

title: Did Van Halen's Concert Contract Require the Removal of Brown M&Ms?
subtitle: In many legends, the 'why' is more important the 'what.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Van Halen's standard performance contract contained a provision calling for them to be provided backstage with a bowl of M&Ms from which all the brown candies had been removed.

title: Bicycle Pump Death
subtitle: A purported thrill in Thailand, pumping air into the rectum with a bicycle pump to get high, was said to be claiming victims at an alarming rate.
statement: A 13-year-old boy in Thailand died from pumping air up his rectum to get high.

title: Nike 'Give Me Big Shoes' Commercial
subtitle: Did a Samburu tribesman say 'Give me big shoes' instead of 'Just Do It' in a Nike commercial?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Samburu tribesman appearing in a Nike commercial was supposed to say the equivalent of "Just Do It" in his native language, but he said something entirely different instead.

title: The Origins of Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer
subtitle: Was Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer created to bring comfort to a girl whose mother was dying of cancer?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The character 'Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer' was created by a father to bring comfort to his daughter as her mother was dying of cancer.

title: Did 'The Green Hornet' Change Kato's Nationality After Pearl Harbor?
subtitle: The nationality of Kato, the Green Hornet's valet, was somewhat ambiguous as World War II began.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The nationality of Kato, the Green Hornet's valet, was abruptly changed after the beginning of World War II.

title: Was the Coca-Cola Bottle Design an Accident?
subtitle: Rumor has it the shape of the Coca-Cola bottle was mistakenly based on the cacoa tree seed pod.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: The shape of the Coca-Cola bottle was mistakenly based on the cacao tree seed pod.

title: Have Disney Character Actors Molested Park Guests?
subtitle: Some complaints have been quite serious.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Costumed cast members have been accused of molesting Disney theme park guests.
